Where do funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal?  No funds are spent; no money is collected at all.  The entire project does not occur; I can't do it without this funding project.  It is all or nothing; it is up to you.

The Impact

You support empowers a myraid of opportunities; such possibilties as:

Graying senior LGBT will benefit spiritually with a beautiful space for reconciliation and contemplation; a networking place to meet for fellowship beyond the meeting rooms of churches, restaurants, and coffee shops; and an outdoor place to walk in an exculsive LGBT designated garden.
Young LGBT have a unique place to romp, meditate; and/or study various prairie plants and prairie life forms.
A new place for LGBT to sing; play warrior Xexia or if you're into a him, a Hercules; and enjoy a wild prairie environment.


My track record of successful prior projects springs from my being a past college student body president, chairman of a teacher's union, and various projects I spearheaded as a public school teacher and as a Peace Corps volunteer overseas in Africa.
Through sixty years, I have witnessed and encountered the traumatic loss experienced at the hands of bigots and know how those painful memories can affect the lives of LGBT.  The prairie garden is a healing place for me and a happy joy to experience.  I believe that this outdoor space is a place of spiritual joy and healing, not just for me, but for all LGBT who come to this prairie garden.  For that reason I offer this garden invitation to my fellow LGBT.  I charge no entrance fee.  I do ask for advanced notice when visitors want to visit.  The prairie plants I establish and maintain at my own cost as part of my seed business named Broad View Wildflower Seed.  The Internet sales site is:  Broadviewwildflowerseed.com



Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make some noise about this project campaign.
Remember to refer to Indiegogo!

story:
The Ocean Sampling Day (OSD) will take place on the longest day in the northern hemisphere in 2014, the summer solstice on June 21st. On this day, more than 100 science teams all around the world will take water samples from the ocean in order to identify the tiniest organisms in it - the microbes.

The outcome of this global effort will be nothing less than the biggest data set in marine research that has been taken on a single day. This vast open-access data set will be incredibly valuable for the marine scientists. It will be the starting point leading to a revolution in marine microbial ecology. Be part of this unique event and help researchers to fight great global problems like climate change. Find more information on www.my-osd.org


For the first time you have the power to directly support marine microbiological research by crowdfunding.This will help to understand the impact of global warming on our biggest ecosystem on Earth - our oceans. No government, no political party, no industrial lobby decides how your money is spend but YOU! It doesn’t matter where you live, if you believe in OSD support it! Every dollar counts! Become a backer and select from a broad variety of rewards.

Citizen Science

Join the OSD and download the sampling App for your smartphone for free. Go out in the field and support the scientist with valuable environmental data on June 21st in 2014. You can even top it up with the perk “Get Active Yourself” and analyze important water parameters by yourself.

The Movie

Immerse yourself in the fascinating world of marine microorganisms. Sit back and enjoy the whole story of the OSD in a compelling documentary. Get insights into the planning, sampling, analysis and documentation of this worldwide event.

What is going to happen with your money?

The Ocean Sampling Day will be a major event in the history of marine research and its data will be extremely useful to tackle global problems. We believe that the public should be well informed about the whole event.

We (Dr. Dennis Fink and Dr. Wolfgang Hankeln) are marine scientists and science communicators. We have already worked with researchers who are engaged in the OSD and we’re passionate about telling you the story about this unique event.

Therefore, the crowdfunding campaign not only supports the event, but also its documentation. With your contribution to the crowdfunding, you help the world’s oceans and you can also look forward to an entertaining documentary about it!


We are a global network of scientists dedicated to tackle the secrets of the unseen marine microbial world. The Ocean Sampling Day will be the key to move the field of marine microbial research a major step forward. Here are Dr. Anna Klindworth and Dr. Mesude Bicak, two of the scientific coordinators of the OSD:


The OSD is organized by the Micro B3 (www.microb3.eu) project and works in close collaboration with experts from the Genomic Standards Consortium (GSC) (http://gensc.org), which is a global community of scientists with the aim to standardize the descriptions of genomes. This way expertise and years of experience are joined in a global effort.

Find out more about the scientists and their motivationat www.oceansamplingday.org

story:
Invest 20 minutes of your time – the future of your grandchildren may depend on it

Before you read any further, please watch the entire movie, so that you understand what we need to accomplish and why it is imperative that we do so (“we” includes everyone, you too). Watch the movie.

 

Why?

It’s really simple. We have X amount of years to completely rid ourselves of greenhouse gas emissions (Nobody knows exactly how few years X is). If we fail to do so our climate will set off on a path towards an earth that will become increasingly more hostile to the majority of the current lifeforms on this planet. This path will be irreversible. Our civilization will eventually come to an end. The vast majority of our great grandchildren will most probably die. Right now we, a supposedly intelligent species, are failing to prevent this cataclysmic future from happening. Watch the movie and you will understand.

The majority of us are “blissfully” uninformed about what is happening to the climate. And the ones who are actually informed, are tired and angry. It seems that no matter what we do we cannot invoke the needed changes fast enough from our society, a society that is largely driven by capital. It seems that all the climate action out there is shaped to influence politicians to make changes, and those changes either do not happen, or do not happen fast enough. Trying to influence others to discuss, to invoke change, to legislate, in order to somewhere down the line curb greenhouse gases, is proving to be a very time-consuming effort for the climate advocates around the world. And normally this is fine, it’s the way democracy works and sways over time. But the dark shadow of the climate threat has put us in a context that is anything but normal, and we are fresh out of the luxurious good called time. These darkening circumstances call for a new type of climate action, a more direct type of climate action.

The Atlas Clan and Helios Initiative were founded to facilitate the most direct climate action possible; There are billions of people on earth and we have the capital to accomplish anything if we do it together. If millions of us back the Helios Initiative and contribute to this massive cause - the building of thousands of solar plants for the greater good of future generations - we can rid ourselves of greenhouse gas emissions from electricity production. It’s direct, it’s simple. And yes, it's very, very, very big. But ultimately we are the people on this earth, and if we do not get our act together, then who?

 

The idea behind the Helios Initiative

We want humanity to wake up, and to jointly invest in our planet, climate and future, by building thousands of solar power plants across the globe. We want this to happen in a relatively short time span so that we can bring down greenhouse gas emissions from electricity production ASAP.

This campaign gathers funds for the first of these solar plants.

We want to build the solar plants in succeeding iterations, where each iteration will build more plants than the previous one, and where the profit from existing plants will be invested into building the next iteration of plants.

We want this to be an effort by humanity, for humanity, that belongs to all of us regardless of who we are.

We want this solar plant and all future plants to contribute to equality amongst all humans on earth.

 

 

Why we need $100 million

We want to build a large solar plant, with a capacity of approximately 100MW which will cost around $100 million (slightly less, please see below). We have chosen a fixed campaign goal so that you can feel safe that your money will actually build a solar plant, or you get your money back (had we chosen flexible funding and only reached and kept a lesser amount kept than we need, then we would not be able to build the solar plant, which is the entire purpose of this initiative)

 

What the money will be spent on

As much as possible of the money that backs this campaign will build the first solar plant. We will of course have to cover costs that are associated with setting up an operating solar plant, such as, but not limited to the design of the plant, country and land selection and acquisition, legal fees (including Solar Power Purchase Agreement), consulting fees (including due diligence and selection of contractor to build the plant). We will also have to cover the transaction costs of running this crowdfunding campaign. Finally, we will need to save a small reserve in cash to pay for the operation and maintenance of the plant before we see the first cash flow from electricity sales.

We do not have the technical knowledge on how to build a solar plant within our organization. We will hire all necessary knowledge. When this campaign gains momentum we will reach out to people and organizations who can give a more detailed picture of the cost distribution.

We will keep updating our backers about how exactly the money will be distributed. But to recap, we want as much of the money as possible to go into building the first solar plant.

 

The timeline

We have chosen to try to raise the funds in 2 months because that is the maximum available on Indiegogo. Given the share size of our goal we would probably have needed a few more months, but two it is. We need this time to get the momentum for the campaign up, to get news outlets curious, to get people sharing on social media, to get people engaged in the initiative. Plus, we need the time to add more details about the Helios Initiative as more and more people join our cause, not just by backing our us, but by joining the Atlas Clan and contributing with knowledge, know-how, passion and skills.

You can really help this Initiative by sharing this page on social media.

 

Regarding perks

By now, campaign backers across the globe are used to obtaining perks when backing campaigns – a shout out, a vlog thank you that you look at once, a t-shirt that you will never wear, your name on a solar panel in a distant place that you will never visit…

Let’s not do that. All perks would be a project on their own, and frankly, we are still a very small organization. We want as much of your money as possible to go into the construction of the first solar plant. Our priority is not to give you gifts, but to keep your great grandkids alive.

So far, gratitude is all we can do. Everything else would be a waste of your time and money.

Besides, for anyone investing in this initiative, the greatest perk ever is that we actually build the first solar plant.

So, select a backing level that you feel comfortable with. Whatever you can give, no matter how small is still a big deal to us.

 

About the Atlas Clan

The Atlas Clan is a Swedish non-profit association founded by Rafael Arelin in 2016. Our humble aim is to gather as much of humanity as possible to jointly build assets and companies that will directly lower the amount of greenhouse gases emitted by humanity. We acknowledge that this is a gargantuan prospect, but the circumstances leave us with few options. The entire human race needs to get engaged for this initiative to work, and the resulting network of assets and companies to belong to humanity. We believe that it will lead to a more equal and better society.  Thus, the assets and companies will be owned by the Atlas Clan, and anyone on earth can join the Atlas Clan as a member and vote in matters concerning the Atlas Clan and the future assets and companies that will be held by the association. The assets and companies held by the Atlas Clan will belong to all adults aged 18 living on earth, regardless if they are members or not. When greenhouse gas emissions are subdued and our climate no longer poses a threat to us, the earnings can be divided evenly among all adults living on earth on a monthly or yearly basis.

 

About the Helios Initiative

Since our politicians and the corporations will not build the full amount of needed solar plants (or other clean power plants) in time to prevent our climate from turning against us, we will need to close the gap by building our own solar plants.

The Helios Initiative is an initiative by the Atlas Clan to gather funds via crowdfunding to build solar plants across the globe to off-set greenhouse gas emissions from coal plants and gas plants. Once we have raised funds for the first solar plant we will create the Helios Initiative company, which will own the first solar plant, and all future plants. All the company’s stock will be owned by the Atlas Clan Association. All the earnings will be reinvested into new solar plants.

Anyone who joins the Atlas Clan as a member will be able to influence the activity of the Helios Initiative company.

 

Join the Clan

We are at the start of our journey. We have an organization, we have our statutes, we have an initiative and a crowdfunding campaign. Most importantly, we have an idea; that together we, the humans on this earth, can rid ourselves of greenhouse gas emissions from electricity production, and by doing so we create an asset that benefits the entire human race.

Back us and change the course of history.

 

What you can do

1) First of all, invest 20 minutes to watch the movie if you already haven’t.

2) Then BACK THIS CAMPAIGN. It’s very simple. When enough people back us this idea will gain momentum. This will give us the necessary clout to speak with all the necessary organisations out there that we need as partners to buld the solar plant. When they are on board, more people will feel confident in backing this project, and it will fly. When it does and when we reach our goal, we will build humanity's first large solar plant, built by all of us. That is massive! Directly after that we will launch a new campaign to build two more solar plants, followed by more campaigns and more solar plants.

3) Share our movie and share our campaign with everyone you are connected to on social media

4) Finally, get engaged. Join the Atlas Clan and spread the word in your own way. If you are super talented at something and passionate about making a direct impact to stop climate change, and you are willing to invest your skills and time into it, then join us!

 

LET'S INVEST IN OUR PLANET!

 

Inspired, curious, doubtful, awed, critical? Or do you just have a question? Send your email to Rafe (rafael.arelin@atlasclan.org)

story:
Our Vision

You already know that the sun is the ultimate source of all forms of energy on our planet. Solar Joulers has developed new technology to help you tap more directly into that infinite source. Solar thermal heat can help you save money, improve your life, and reduce your carbon footprint.  

Solar Joulers' products capture the sun's free energy directly in the form of heat, and help eliminate our dependence on fossil fuel. Nearly half of all global energy use, and 2/3 of U.S. household energy, is for heating processes. We at Solar Joulers believe we can help free people from the shackles of burning fossil fuel for heat.

Consider:

  • ≈ $250,000,000,000 ($250 Billion) spent annually in the US to purchase fossil fuels for heating processes.
  • ≈ $1,000,000,000,000 ($1 Trillion) spent globally to purchase fossil fuels for heating each year.
  • Over 10,000,000,000 (Ten Billion) tons of pollutants, CO2, and other greenhouse gases emitted into our environment each year, just for heating.
  • 1,000,000,000+ (1 Billion) of our fellow human beings consume biologically contaminated water every day!

Our Goal is to help everyone become more energy independent, and promote a more sustainable future, while reducing our impact on the planet.

Our World Vision includes the belief that together, we can also help provide relief to the billions of residents of our planet that lack access to safe drinking water. Solar Thermal can help provide the solution.


Where We Are Now

The Solar Joulers Team has spent 7 years preparing for this product launch. We have built, tested, learned, re-designed, tested, demonstrated and proved the technology, materials and supply chain. Solar Jouler modules are the lightest, easiest-to-install, most reliable, and the lowest dollar-per-watt installed cost available.

Easiest to install, great durability, light weight, high performance, lowest installed cost, and fast payback. We now have our ducks lined up and are ready to go to the next level.

What We Need to Reach the Next Level

To achieve our goals we need to implement the following tasks, designed to scale our company up from an R&D facility to full scale production:

  • Purchase, install and train workers on the use of large capacity automation equipment.
  • Factory upgrades.
  • Hiring and training production workers.
  • Large scale procurement of raw materials.
  • Form Business Development and Customer Experience team.
  • More Testing, and Certification which qualifies our customers for government and utility rebates.
  • See our Launch Schedule below for a time line to implement these steps after we achieve funding.
If we don't make our Indiegogo funding goal in the allotted time, Indiegogo will refund your contribution, and Solar Joulers will pursue other funding avenues.

Launch Schedule

The above timeline shows the major tasks we plan to achieve and how we will put your money to use, to reach production capability.

What You Get

To help us achieve our funding goal, we offer the following Perks. The Perks are briefly described in the right hand panel; details are here.

Solar App for Smart Devices – $99

Use the Solar App for Smart Devices to accurately position an SJ-1 or SJ-3 Portable Collector. The App is designed to work with Smart Devices including iOS and Android.

Simply place the Smart Device on the collector surface and adjust collector position for optimal Solar Collection Efficiency for your precise location.

App calculates Energy Offset, Fuel Cost Savings, ROI & Payback Time, and CO2 Offset in Tons over the lifetime of the System.

Alternately, you may use the app calculator to determine the benefits of using solar thermal at your location.

Key Specifications:

Azimuth Accuracy +/- 5 degrees
Altitude Accuracy +/- 5 degrees

Features:

  • Easily Adjust Azimuth (Orientation towards South)
  • Easily Adjust Altitude (Tilt towards the Sun)

Based Type of Fossil Fuel Being Offset and Your Location, the App Calculates:

  • Fuel Cost Savings
  • ROI and Payback Time
  • Lifetime CO2 Offsets

SJ-1 Portable Solar Thermal Starter Kit – $499

The SJ-1 Portable Solar Thermal Starter Kit sets up and transports easily. The SJ-1 is rated at 400 Watts, and includes the following components:
  • SJ-1 Portable Collector with Foldable Legs
    		•
  • 5 Gallon insulated Potable Beverage Storage Tank
    		•
  • Mini Solar Circulation Pump
    		•
  • 15 Watt Solar PV Panel
    		•
  • Insulated Connector Lines
    		•
  • Thermometer
    		•

    Potential Uses:

    • Hot Water for RVs, Camping, Picnics, Tailgating
    • Small Hot Tub Heating
    • Heat Food or Beverages
    • Hot Water for Washing
    • Hot Water for Cleaning & Personal Hygiene
    • Water Pasteurization (above 140F)

    Key Specifications:

    Efficiency @ N fluid = 0 >78%
    Efficiency @ N fluid = 0.15 >60%
    Solar Aperture 5.33 Square Feet
    Watts Collected @ 1000 w/m2 Solar Input at N fluid = 0 >400 watts
    Weight 35 Pounds
    Dimensions 54 x 17 x 3 Inches
    Assembly Time < 15 Minutes
    Recommended Window Replacement Interval 10 years (Hot Swappable)
    Warranty 10 Years

    Construction Details:

    # Heat Pipes 4
    Frame Construction Aluminum and Fiberglass
    Window Construction UV Protected Polycarbonate
    Heat Exchanger Construction Anodized Aluminum



    SJ-3 Portable Solar Thermal Starter Kit – $999

    The SJ-3 Portable Solar Thermal Starter Kit sets up and transports easily. The SJ-3 is rated at 1200 Watts, and includes the following components:
    • SJ-3 Portable Collector with Foldable Legs
      		•
    • 10 Gallon insulated Potable Beverage Storage Tank
      		•
    • Mini Solar Circulation Pump
      		•
    • 15 Watt Solar PV Panel
      		•
    • Insulated Connector Lines
      		•
    • Thermometer
      		•


      Potential Uses:

      • Hot Water for RVs, Camping, Picnics, Tailgating
      • Large Hot Tub Heating
      • Heat Food or Beverages
      • Hot Water for Washing
      • Hot Water for Cleaning & Personal Hygiene

      Time To Free Energy

      If you live between the green and orange areas of the solar map below, you can find your time to payback (before gov't and utility rebates) depending on the fuel you are currently using. From then on, you get Free Energy!


      Frequently Asked Questions

      Why do you call yourselves the Solar Joulers?

      A “Joule” is a scientific unit of energy. We harvest and store “Joules.” We like to think of it as harvesting “jewels” of solar energy.

      How do Solar Joulers’ (SJI) collectors work?

      Our modules use heat pipes (HP) to transport the heat from the black collector surface into a concealed heat exchanger at the top of the collector where it is transferred to the heating system fluid. There are no mechanical moving parts to break.

      Please watch the video or refer to our web site for more information.

      How are SJI systems different?

      Traditional panels circulate fluid into a bottom header (large pipe) and up through many smaller pipes (risers) attached to the black collector. The Sun’s energy is transferred into the risers. The heated fluid exits the risers into a top header and is pumped back to the storage tank.

      In solar thermal collectors that use glass vacuum tubes, the internal heat pipes may operate at very high temperatures.  They are prone to overheating reliability problems.  The vacuum tubes plug into a heat exchanger above them—a rather unsightly arrangement.

      In SJI collectors, the heat transferring fluid only flows through a heat exchanger at the top—there are no risers. The heat exchanger sits behind the black solar surface, so no solar-collecting-area is wasted and the collectors look very attractive. Aluminum and polycarbonate plastic are used, which makes the assembled array virtually unbreakable yet lightweight.

      How is solar thermal (ST) different than photovoltaic (PV)?

      ST collects the sun’s energy as heat. PV converts it into electricity. ST is about 500% more efficient than PV, and takes up only 1/5 the collector mount area as PV. The installed cost per Watt of ST is about half the cost of PV. PV works well for generating electricity, but ST is the best solution for heating applications.

      Why should we consider doing this?

      Many SJI installations will save you money from day one... Your average utility savings will be more than your monthly system payment. You become more energy independent; immune from rising energy costs, and when the system is paid off, you have a perpetual abundance of free energy for decades—see Time to Free Energy TTFE chart.

      You can play an important role in reducing greenhouse gases too... Heating hot water plus your house can reduce your carbon emissions by 25-60%. Reduced pollution translates to healthier lives. You are also contributing to better national energy security. 

      Why is overall system cost lower with Solar Jouler systems?

      The total cost of the installed system (design services + components + shipping + installation + maintenance) is lower. If one of our pre-designed systems does not meet your needs, at no extra cost—we will design one for you that will. We sell direct to you or through certified specialists.

      Traditional panels typically weigh 150 lbs, or more, and must be shipped by freight and require insurance. Our modules weigh approximately 20 lbs each; ship by UPS or FedEx without insurance; do not require a crane to lift them onto a roof, and are easily assembled on-site. Roof-mounted systems already include the cost of the mounting tracks. No soldering is required.

      In short, installation takes less time and is ideal for do-it-yourself people. Professional installation costs less too because it takes less time. Replacing parts (if ever needed) takes little time. Our high reliability assures low maintenance costs. All this adds up to lower system cost.

      What happens to Solar Jouler collectors during stagnation?

      Nothing!

      Stagnation is the condition where the pump is off while the sun is shining. This causes the collectors to overheat and expand, and may result in emergency repairs in current systems. It is an industry-wide problem.

      Solar Jouler collectors are designed to tolerate overheating and keep internal temperatures within reasonable levels.

      Why are Solar Joulers Collectors more reliable?

      The heated fluid only flows through a thick-walled heat exchanger. The heat exchanger modules connect with ultra-reliable flange joints.

      Traditional panels have many weld joints, which increases their probability of a leak. A leak becomes an emergency!  SJI systems have no weld joints other than the ultra-reliable fusion of the flange to the heat exchanger.

      SJI collectors tolerate stagnation without damage. They mount on tracks that allow thermal expansion and contraction. The heat transport system has built-in redundancy. If a SJI system has 96 heat pipes (4 per heat pipe module) and one fails, 95 will still continue working full-strength; allowing its neighbors to pick up the slack. Because this synergistic cooperation is ultra reliable, our overall reliability is governed by the thick walls of our heat exchangers and their fused flanges. Our chance of a fluid leak is simply a lot lower.

      Our systems contain no glass.

      What about maintenance?

      SJI modules are designed to last and have built in redundancy. If ever needed, repairs are simple and quick. It takes 15 minutes to hot-swap a module without shutting down the system.  If a “riser” leaks on a traditional panel, it causes an emergency and the whole system must be shut down until it is fixed. For economic reasons, these risers must be thin-walled; therefore they are more prone to leaking.

      SJI recommends basic system check and service at 5 year intervals.

      How long will SJ collectors last?

      SJ collectors are designed and built to operate for decades.  Main aluminum components may last for up to 99 years or more. The polycarbonate plastic window is impregnated with UV protection. The manufacturer specifies a 20-year life. In ten years, the top glazing may be less efficient by up to 10% (and then it stays at that level). At the owner’s option, it could be replaced. It’s a 5-minute job to replace an inexpensive window.

      What about warranty of the components?

      We warrant the HPM portion of the collector for 10 years. We warrant the heat exchanger portion of the collector for 10 years as well, provided non-corrosive fluids are used. With proper attention to the type of fluids used in the heat exchanger, a SJI collector should operate for many decades.

      Is Solar right for my location?

      Solar thermal works well in most geographic locations that receive adequate sunshine. Collectors should face a southerly direction (SE-S-SW optimal) in areas free of shade. Please point towards NE-N-NW if you reside in the southern hemisphere.

      Other cost benefit factors include your fuel type, cost and usage. Please refer to the Time to Free Energy (TTFE) table for an estimate in years for your location. Our smart App, once implemented, will quickly show you the expected payback time for various configurations for your location. You can be involved in choosing your optimal system. 

      How does the Solar Jouler App work? What can I do with it?

      Using your smart device, the App helps you position your portable collector for optimum performance. Simply place your smart device on the collector surface and the App directs you to the optimal tilt position and compass orientation for your location and time of year.  This takes the guesswork out of collector positioning.

      Based on your location, fuel type, fuel cost, fuel usage and expected inflation rate, the App looks up historical solar data and calculates your estimated payback time and how many tons of CO2 is kept from spewing into the air.

      Future updates include GPS and satellite mapping with remote design capabilities, as well as measuring and reporting the energy collected, money saved, and carbon offset in easy to understand graphs.

      I am handy with tools, can I install it myself or must I use a professional?

      Our systems are designed for a simple, quick installation. They require only a handful of ordinary tools. No soldering is required. The heaviest component only weighs 20 lbs so an adult can easily carry them to the installation site. Each module is secured to the mounting track with a metal “key.” A three-wide array (SJ-3) should only take about 15 minutes to install onto the track. Track mounting time depends on the site. Mounting to a roof or a wall should only take a short time.

      If you roof-mount, you may elect to have a licensed person do this part of the job.  An unlicensed person making “roof penetrations” may void the part of your insurance covering roof leaks.

      We recommend that you (1) use a local professional installer, or (2) consult with your local building department if you plan to install a system yourself.

      What ways can I mount Solar Jouler collectors?

      They can be mounted flush with the roof, on struts, on a wall or on ground supports.  Strut mounts are the most solar-efficient, but they require extra hardware and they usually require engineering.  Flush roof mounts are simpler, but may be less solar efficient.  However, adding a few more collectors to a flush-mounted system may cost no more when considering that the track-mounting hardware cost is already included—and they are more attractive. Mounting to a south-facing wall is a good option for space heating because it optimizes winter sun.

      How many solar modules can be connected together?

      You may build arrays up to 30 modules wide. However, multiple arrays can operate in parallel, so there is really no limit to the size of a properly designed system.

      Can I use Solar Jouler collectors to heat my home?

      Yes—a hot water system can be expanded to include space heating. It works best with baseboard radiators or radiant heating systems.  A SJI system can also be used to assist a forced air heat-pump-based system to heat your whole house.

      We also have a space-heating application note that shows how to incorporate a simple radiator. Solar panels are installed on a south-facing wall with radiator(s) on the opposite side of the wall. This is ideal for multi-storey buildings. It will still heat during power outages and during the aftermath of a “super storm.”

      What can I use a portable solar collector for?

      Our portable systems create new plug-and-play markets used for: RV’s, camping, picnics, tailgating, ice fishing, or anywhere and everywhere.  Potential uses include portable showers, cleaning dishes and utensils, washing clothes, washing hands, heating beverages and food, hot tubs, pasteurizing water, and space heating small rooms, sheds, greenhouses, playhouses, doghouses, etc.  There may be many other uses you can envision!

      Why will it take 9 to 12 months to get my product delivered?

      We presently manufacture units in low volume with a small staff. Our initial focus will be on manufacturing staffing and tooling. We need additional skilled staff to streamline and further improve our manufacturing processes.  The tooling lets us build product cost effectively. We will continue to do extensive reliability testing to confirm the quality and long life of our products.

      We estimate that in less than 6-months, key manufacturing and business functions will be operational. Once we’ve thoroughly tested newly manufactured units for quality and performance, we will submit our panels for SRCC certification (which is required for tax rebates and other incentives). We expect to begin delivery of small systems within 9-months from funding completion. Larger systems will take a few months longer.

      Why might I want to invest in SJI?

      We have several patents pending, and the product design is complete and tested. With our revolutionary collector designs we expect to transform global energy markets, for a better tomorrow, starting today. The market potential for our solution is compelling because the payback is quick and the lifetime cost savings are enormous.  Our ability to reduce the use of fossil fuels and carbon footprint is real. By investing in SJI you help make our shared vision a reality.

      The world will be a better place when we harness the generous power of the sun!
story_txt:
Our Vision
You already know that the sun is the ultimate source of all forms of energy on our planet. Solar Joulers has developed new technology to help you tap more directly into that infinite source. Solar thermal heat can help you save money, improve your life, and reduce your carbon footprint.  
Solar Joulers' products capture the sun's free energy directly in the form of heat, and help eliminate our dependence on fossil fuel. Nearly half of all global energy use, and 2/3 of U.S. household energy, is for heating processes. We at Solar Joulers believe we can help free people from the shackles of burning fossil fuel for heat.

Consider:

≈ $250,000,000,000 ($250 Billion) spent annually in the US to purchase fossil fuels for heating processes.
≈ $1,000,000,000,000 ($1 Trillion) spent globally to purchase fossil fuels for heating each year.
Over 10,000,000,000 (Ten Billion) tons of pollutants, CO2, and other greenhouse gases emitted into our environment each year, just for heating.
1,000,000,000+ (1 Billion) of our fellow human beings consume biologically contaminated water every day!
Our Goal is to help everyone become more energy independent, and promote a more sustainable future, while reducing our impact on the planet.Our World Vision includes the belief that together, we can also help provide relief to the billions of residents of our planet that lack access to safe drinking water. Solar Thermal can help provide the solution.

Where We Are Now
The Solar Joulers Team has spent 7 years preparing for this product launch.  We have built, tested, learned, re-designed, tested, demonstrated and proved the technology, materials and supply chain. Solar Jouler modules are the lightest, easiest-to-install, most reliable, and the lowest dollar-per-watt installed cost available. Easiest to install, great durability, light weight, high performance, lowest installed cost, and fast payback. We now have our ducks lined up and are ready to go to the next level.
What We Need to Reach the Next Level
To achieve our goals we need to implement the following tasks, designed to scale our company up from an R&D facility to full scale production:

Purchase, install and train workers on the use of large capacity automation equipment.
Factory upgrades.
Hiring and training production workers.
Large scale procurement of raw materials.
Form Business Development and Customer Experience team.
More Testing, and Certification which qualifies our customers for government and utility rebates.
See our Launch Schedule below for a time line to implement these steps after we achieve funding.


If we don't make our Indiegogo funding goal in the allotted time, Indiegogo will refund your contribution, and Solar Joulers will pursue other funding avenues.

Launch ScheduleThe above timeline shows the major tasks we plan to achieve and how we will put your money to use, to reach production capability.
What You Get
To help us achieve our funding goal, we offer the following Perks.  The Perks are briefly described in the right hand panel; details are here.
Solar App for Smart Devices – $99
 Use the Solar App for Smart Devices to accurately position an SJ-1 or SJ-3 Portable Collector.  The App is designed to work with Smart Devices including iOS and Android.

Simply place the Smart Device on the collector surface and adjust collector position for optimal Solar Collection Efficiency for your precise location.

App calculates Energy Offset, Fuel Cost Savings, ROI & Payback Time, and CO2 Offset in Tons over the lifetime of the System.

Alternately, you may use the app calculator to determine the benefits of using solar thermal at your location.

    required. 
In short, installation takes less time and is ideal
    for do-it-yourself people. Professional installation costs less too because it
    takes less time. Replacing parts (if ever needed) takes little time. Our high
    reliability assures low maintenance costs. All this adds up to lower system
    cost. 
What happens to Solar Jouler collectors during stagnation?
Nothing!
Stagnation
    is the condition where the pump is off while the sun is shining. This causes
    the collectors to overheat and expand, and may result in emergency repairs in
    current systems. It is an industry-wide problem.
Solar
    Jouler collectors are designed to tolerate overheating and keep internal
    temperatures within reasonable levels.
Why are Solar Joulers Collectors more reliable?
The heated fluid only flows through a thick-walled
    heat exchanger. The heat exchanger modules connect with ultra-reliable flange
    joints. 
Traditional panels have many weld joints, which
    increases their probability of a leak. A leak becomes an emergency!  SJI systems have no weld joints other than
    the ultra-reliable fusion of the flange to the heat exchanger. 
SJI
    collectors tolerate stagnation without damage. They mount on tracks that allow
    thermal expansion and contraction. The heat transport system has built-in
    redundancy. If a
    SJI system has 96 heat pipes (4 per heat pipe module) and one fails, 95 will
    still continue working full-strength; allowing its neighbors to pick up the
    slack. Because this synergistic cooperation is ultra
    reliable, our overall reliability is governed by the thick walls of our heat
    exchangers and their fused flanges. Our chance of a fluid leak is simply a lot
    lower. 
Our systems contain no glass. 
What about maintenance?
SJI modules are designed to last and have built in
    redundancy. If ever needed, repairs are simple and quick. It takes 15 minutes
    to hot-swap a module without shutting down the system.  If a “riser” leaks on a traditional panel, it causes
    an emergency and the whole system must be shut down until it is fixed. For
    economic reasons, these risers must be thin-walled; therefore they are more
    prone to leaking. 
SJI recommends basic system check and service at 5 year
    intervals.
How long will SJ collectors last?
SJ
    collectors are designed and built to operate for decades.  Main aluminum components may last for up to
    99 years or more. The polycarbonate plastic window is impregnated with UV
    protection. The manufacturer specifies a 20-year life. In ten years, the top
    glazing may be less efficient by up to 10% (and then it stays at that level).
    At the owner’s option, it could be replaced. It’s a 5-minute job to replace an
    inexpensive window.
What about warranty of the components?
We warrant the HPM portion of the collector for 10
    years. We warrant the heat exchanger portion of the collector for 10 years as
    well, provided non-corrosive fluids are used. With proper attention to the type
    of fluids used in the heat exchanger, a SJI collector should operate for many decades.
Is Solar right for my location?
Solar
    thermal works well in most geographic locations that receive adequate
    sunshine. Collectors should face a
    southerly direction (SE-S-SW optimal) in areas free of shade. Please point towards NE-N-NW if
    you reside in the southern hemisphere.
Other cost benefit factors include your fuel type, cost and usage. Please refer to the Time to Free Energy (TTFE) table for an estimate in years for your location. Our smart App, once
    implemented, will quickly show you the expected payback time for
    various configurations for your location. You can be involved in choosing your
    optimal system. 
How does the Solar Jouler App work? What can I do
    with it?
Using your smart device, the App helps you position your
    portable collector for optimum performance. Simply place your smart device on
    the collector surface and the App directs you to the optimal tilt position and
    compass orientation for your location and time of year.  This takes the
    guesswork out of collector positioning.
Based
    on your location, fuel type, fuel cost, fuel usage and expected inflation rate,
    the App looks up historical solar data and calculates your estimated payback
    time and how many tons of CO2 is kept from spewing into the air. 
Future updates include GPS and satellite mapping with remote design capabilities, as well as measuring and reporting the energy
    collected, money saved, and carbon offset in easy to understand graphs. 
I am handy with tools, can I install it myself or must I use a professional?
Our
    systems are designed for a simple, quick installation. They require only a
    handful of ordinary tools. No soldering is required. The heaviest component
    only weighs 20 lbs so an adult can easily carry them to the installation site.
    Each module is secured to the mounting track with a metal “key.” A three-wide array
    (SJ-3) should only take about 15
    minutes to install onto the track. Track mounting time depends on the site.
    Mounting to a roof or a wall should only take a short time.
If you roof-mount, you may elect to have a licensed
    person do this part of the job.  An
    unlicensed person making “roof penetrations” may void the part of your
    insurance covering roof leaks. 
We recommend that you (1) use a local professional
    installer, or (2) consult with your local building department if you plan to
    install a system yourself. 
What ways can I mount Solar Jouler collectors?
They can be mounted flush with the roof, on struts, on a
    wall or on ground supports.  Strut mounts
    are the most solar-efficient, but they require extra hardware and they usually
    require engineering.  Flush roof mounts
    are simpler, but may be less solar efficient.  However, adding a few more collectors to a
    flush-mounted system may cost no more when considering that the track-mounting
    hardware cost is already included—and they are more attractive. Mounting to a
    south-facing wall is a good option for space heating because it optimizes
    winter sun.
How many solar modules can be connected together?
You may build arrays up to 30 modules wide. However,
    multiple arrays can operate in parallel, so there is really no limit to the
    size of a properly designed system.
Can I use Solar Jouler collectors to heat my home?
Yes—a hot water system can be expanded to include space
    heating. It works best with baseboard radiators or radiant heating
    systems.  A SJI system can also be used
    to assist a forced air heat-pump-based system to heat your whole house.
We also have a space-heating application note that shows
    how to incorporate a simple radiator. Solar panels are installed on a
    south-facing wall with radiator(s) on the opposite side of the wall. This is
    ideal for multi-storey buildings. It will still heat during power outages and
    during the aftermath of a “super storm.”
What can I use a portable solar collector for?
Our portable systems create new plug-and-play markets used
    for: RV’s, camping, picnics, tailgating, ice fishing, or anywhere and
    everywhere.  Potential uses include portable
    showers, cleaning dishes and utensils, washing clothes, washing hands, heating beverages and food, hot tubs, pasteurizing
    water, and space heating small rooms, sheds, greenhouses, playhouses,
    doghouses, etc.  There may be many other
    uses you can envision! 
Why will it take 9 to 12 months to get my product delivered?
We presently manufacture units in low volume with a small
    staff. Our initial focus will be on manufacturing staffing and tooling. We need
    additional skilled staff to streamline and further improve our manufacturing
    processes.  The tooling lets us build
    product cost effectively. We will continue to do extensive reliability testing
    to confirm the quality and long life of our products.
We estimate that in less than 6-months, key manufacturing
    and business functions will be operational. Once we’ve thoroughly tested newly
    manufactured units for quality and performance, we will submit our panels for
    SRCC certification (which is required for tax rebates and other incentives). We
    expect to begin delivery of small systems within 9-months from funding completion.
    Larger systems will take a few months longer.
Why might I want to
    invest in SJI?
We have several patents pending, and the
    product design is complete and tested. With our revolutionary collector designs
    we expect to transform global energy markets, for a better tomorrow, starting
    today. The market potential for our solution is compelling because the payback
    is quick and the lifetime cost savings are enormous.  Our ability to reduce the use of fossil fuels
    and carbon footprint is real. By investing in SJI you help make our shared vision
    a reality. 
The world will be a better place when we
    harness the generous power of the sun!

story:
Summary

Environmental problems like water shortage, air pollution are prominent issues in cities of India today. The environment is worsening at an alarming rate and calls for action, support, environmental solutions.

We are trying to gather everyone's support to bring about a change in the current state of affairs. Planting a million trees in cities to alleviate the said problem.

Maybe we cannot save the trees, but we can plant them and sustain them.

  • This generates enough oxygen for the population.
  • Intercepts the rainwater and prevent flooding.
  • Promotes a greener planet

What We Need

This is a years spanning project. We plant trees and personally sustain them for 3 years.

We need all the funding we can acquire. The $3,000 goal will help skyrocket this campaign to greater heights.

All  the funds raised through this campaign (even if it doesn't meet the goal) will go directly to the Million Trees Initiative campaign.

The Impact

Despite the alarming problem of global warming, we emit CO2, cut trees and use papers.

It is high time we planted trees.

  • One person covers an average of one ton of CO2 per year.
  • One Tree removes about a ton of CO2 per year.
  • One human consumes about 130lbs of oxygen per year.
  • One Tree produces about 260lbs of oxygen per year

Help

Together, let's make this worthwhile.

We plant trees on lands with no trees, help them grow healthy by taking care of them for 3 years.

Fortunately, planting trees is still ours to do and we love it.

Let's give life to this planet and make it a better place for us and future generations.

  • Get this out to family and friends.
  • Also use the share tool.

Join the Million Tree Initiative

story:
Heat Our Home Project

In Votuporanga/SP, Brazil, there is a nice place that welcomes children at social risk. A simple house, as the house of his mother's people, where no lack of caring, warm food, fragrant bath.

A small school, with super cool aunts who teach with all care and attention.

A place of charm that at the end of the day, welcomes parents and the community with a juicy and tasty soup.

On Saturdays, also beckons with a new life for adults and adolescents, offering free courses in several areas: craft, electricity, computing, painting, pregnant women, music education, performing arts, school support, among others.

Sunday morning we serve a delicious and cozy cafe for children and adolescents who participate in storytelling lessons of history, which perhaps this, is the only meal of the day.

At last, a pleasant place where volunteers cut hair and do nails of the feet and hands of women, totally for free.

This place is full of charm Benevolent Association "Irmão Mariano Dias", located in the southern region of Votuporanga/SP, Brazil, in one of the largest municipal poverty pockets.

In kindergarten, more than 100 children attended a day with access to quality education, food and leisure, with a multidisciplinary team consisting of educators and educational psychologists.

For all this, we are launching the Heat Our Home Project, to enable the installation of a Solar Power Generation System.

Can you imagine the power consumption to keep it all working? Are two daily baths to more than 40 children, four classrooms with lamps and fans, computer room with 20 computers, in the kitchen are three refrigerators and three freezers, which guarantee the supply of all.

He thought about energy consumption? What's more, all this could be powered by energy generated by sunlight!

The city of Votuporanga stands out for its high insolation rate, that equates to the North and Northeast of the country. It is strong year-round sunshine!

Installing a solar power system would generate a reduction of 95% in electricity consumption of the entity.

This economy would be vital for more investments in the menu of children in the acquisition of material consumption, toys and educational and leisure facilities, maintenance and improvement of the institution.

In addition, it would serve as an example for the environment teaching and sustainability.

The Benevolent Association "Irmão Mariano Dias"

Noted that much of the urban population of Votuporanga / SP, Brazil, especially one installed in suburbs, lived in the context of extreme material poverty, lack of affection and of moral principles and devoid of opportunities to enjoy a dignified life.

Knowing large and deep family dramas where adults, youth, adolescents and children followed their days through the dark alleys of pain, suffering and desesperança. Registering the silent cry of peoples fair, honest, waiting for friends and sensitive hearts that could point them a good way.

Was born The Benevolent Association "Irmão Mariano Dias" in order to develop actions that can alleviate, at least in part, the grief and the hardships that plagued and tormented so many human beings.

In 2015 our association complete 30 years of uninterrupted foundation, work and helping peoples!

We currently serve more than 100 children and adolescents, aged 2-12 years from 7am to 6pm, Monday to Friday, where they receive four meals, computer courses, music, performing arts, painting on canvas, painting fabric, crafts, tutoring, recreation and others.

On Saturdays the doors of "Irmão Mariano Dias", open the period of 1pm to 5pm, for the whole community where children are welcomed, adolescents, youth, adults and seniors, for participate in recreation, courses in painting on canvas, fabric painting, crafts, performing arts, computing, electricity, design, pregnant women, among others.
See more photos on our Facebook page: Benevolent Association "Irmão Mariano Dias".

The Benevolent Association "Imão Mariano Dias", began operations on September 27, 1985, is recognized as:

  • Municipal Public Institution, pursuant Municipal Law No. 2176 of 10/9/1987
  • State Public Institution, pursuant to State Law No. 8228 of 1/8/1993
  • Federal Public Institution, pursuant to Decree 02/12/1998

He is enrolled in:

  • Municipal Social Welfare Council, under No. 005/97
  • Municipal Council for the Rights of Children and Adolescents, under No. 017/2001
  • State Department of Social Welfare and Development, under No. 446l of 22/07/1988
  • State Council for Aid and Subsidies - CEAS, under No. 2829/88
  • National Council of Welfare, under No. 28996-021867 / 94-94
  • Educational Establishment of the City by Ordinance of SME 01/04/2002

National Register of Legal Entities (CNPJ) No. 49.074.222/0001-48

It has its own headquarters at Rua Miguel Andreo, 2316 - Palm Garden I, Votuporanga/SP, Brazil.

Solar Photovoltaic System - Solar Energy

A photovoltaic solar energy system, also called solar energy system is a system capable of generating electricity from solar radiation.

A photovoltaic system has three basic components:

  • Solar panel: reacts with sunlight and produces electricity (photovoltaics). They are installed on the roof and connected to the voltage inverter.
  • Voltage Inverter: converts solar energy from its solar panels (current Continues - CC) into electrical energy that can be used in your house or company for TV, Computer, Machinery, Equipment, and any electrical equipment (alternating current - AC ).
  • Meter Bidirectional: measures the energy distribution company that is consumed when there is no sun and also the excess solar energy generated when you have lots of sunshine. This excess energy is injected, returned in the distribution network. The solar energy that goes into the grid and turns "energy credits".

In other words, you produce clean energy with the sunlight and reduces the energy bill!

Investment:

  • Ideal investment: U$ 22,000.00
  • Photovoltaic Solar Kit 10kWp - U$ 18,500.00
  • Building adaptation -  U$ 2,000.00
  • Electronic showers / Other expenses -  U$ 1,500.00

Partner with us. Give your contribution!

Children and young people assisted by the association will be eternally grateful to you!

Contribution #1: Any value - Many thanks. We are very grateful for your help. Your name will be permamente on our site.

Contribution #2: U$ 220.00 - Your name will be permanently engraved on a metal plate on the entity as Official Patron of the Project: "Heat Our Home".  Receive a monthly email about the project's progress as well as the activities developed by the entity. Many thanks. We are very grateful for your help. Your name will be permamente on our site.

Children, youth and adolescents assisted by the Benevolent Association thank all of you.

Collaborate! Share! Help us!

story:
Olá!

O meu nome é Fábio Félix e sou apaixonado por meteorologia desde que me lembro!

Nos últimos anos passei muitas horas na Internet a aprender de forma autodidata sobre meteorologia e há pouco mais de 1 ano decidi criar uma página no Facebook onde faço previsões...

Começou inicialmente por ser uma brincadeira mas transformou-se em algo mais com o crescimento exponencial nos últimos 3 meses, quase com 6000 seguidores já e um feedback extremamente positivo

Decidi então criar um site e venho pedir a vossa contribuição, por mais pequena que seja para ajudar a pagar a despesa de criação do website.

 

O site está praticamente criado, no entanto o custo são cerca de 500€ para 5 anos de alojamento online...

Obrigado a todos desde já que contribuirem para este projeto!

story:
Short Summary

Our Goal is to remove the plastic in not-domestic activity:

We know that we are sourranded by Plastic and is quite difficult to avoid it because all the packaging, case, cutlery are made with this material.

In the business world there a lot of certification, for example for Forests, for Quality, to Export in foreign country etc..

WHY THERE IS NOT A PLASTIC FREE CERTIFICATION?

our goal is to do that and , with your help,  more people we involve, more impact we'll have.

sky is the limit. cit.

What We Need & What You Get

We need only that you avoid those plastic item in your office, bar, pub, restaurant:

- Cofee Glasses

- Disches

-Cutlery

-Bottles

-Spoons

 

with those efforts, you can say you've joined the'No Plastic Game' Club!!

The Impact

 

Risks & Challenges

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Economic contribute is not mandatory, but we will appreciate if you share our idea with you friends and family. The Goal is to reduce the palstic on Earth!

story:
Short Summary

The Glampp at Figueirinha crowdfunding campaign has 3 main objectives:

  1. Build a prototype of the Glampp Ecosystem 40, a sustainable glamping module for ecotourism.
  2. Implement Glamping at Figueirinha, an ecotourism venture in south-west Portugal. Glamping provides an unique outdoors experience with the luxury of a city accommodation.
  3. Promote the conservation of the southwest coast of Portugal through sustainable practices of tourism.

You can contribute to the above by participating to a surf camp, to workshops, cycling along the one of the most well preserved coastlines in Europe or just relax in our Glampp or countryside rooms and enjoy the local food.

 

 

The Glampp Ecosystem 40

The Glampp Ecosystem 40 is a glamping module for sustainable tourism.

  • The Glampp Ecosystem 40 has been designed to use less materials and resources than conventional tourism ventures, making it a more sustainable tourism product;
  • There are no permanent installations, meaning that the site will be conserved and maintained to the original after removing the module.
  • It uses recyclable materials and either local sustainable wood or FSC certified wood.
  • It relies fully on 100% renewable energy through the use of solar panels, being thus energetically self-sufficient.
  • It uses elements from solar passive and permaculture design, such as the solar water heating system and the compost toilet.
  • It is smart: email reports and alarms can be sent to the site manager providing the status of the technical systems, such as the charging state of the solar battery array or water supply level.
  • You are closer to nature while enjoying the comfort from home!

 

 

Figueirinha Ecotourism, Southwest Alentejo, Portugal

Figueirinha Ecoturismo is a small venture of little less than 2 hectares (or 5 acres) with olive trees, organic farming, a main house with a central kitchen and living room, an outbuilding and a natural swimming pool.

In the main house there is the "Forno" (oven) room, sharing its thick walls with the traditional wooden oven, and in the "Casa Nova" (new house) outbuilding you find the "Serra" (hill) and the "Ribeira" (brook) rooms.

Thanks to its location within the borders of the National Ecological Reserve, Figueirinha is granted the silence and tranquillity of an off the beaten track refuge, even in the busy summer months of July and August. Still, it’s only 25 minutes away from the most beautiful and unspoilt beaches of the Southwest Alentejo and Vicentine Coast Natural Park.

Despite of behind rural, all needs are fulfilled and comfort was not left aside. Our solar panels assure complete energy self-sufficiency. Room kitchens are equipped with fridge, microwave oven and electric water heater.

You may ride our mountain bikes for free, hike on trails close by, swim in our natural pool or use our volleyball field. The nearest hamlet, Monte da Estrada, is a half hour walk away. There, the audacious can try the typical "café com cheirinho" (espresso coffee with a sip of "aguardente", a kind of pomace brandy). Other typical villages, such as São Luís, Vila Nova de Milfontes and Odemira, are easily reached by car.

Figueirinha is a perfect spot for those who want a restorative retreat to clean both body and soul. Yet, there’s also room for gastronomic gatherings based on Mediterranean food.

We produce our own vegetables and buy our other food items in local markets or from fair trade organizations. The same principles were applied on our furniture, fixtures or bedlinen.

Come visit us and meet the simplicity of Alentejo’s nature with a familiar and friendly touch.

 

 

"Did you know that Portugal has an estimated 3300 hours of sunshine per year, one of the highest rates in Europe?"

– www.visitportugal.com

 

 “The fish you eat here is just fantastic! I would live here just because of the fish”

– Jeremy Irons, actor

 

“Our deal: no waves? Come back for FREE!"

– www.portuguesewaves.com

 

What We Need

We need funds to build a prototype of the Glampp Ecosystem 40 at Figueirinha Ecoturismo in southwest Portugal.  We have already contacted suppliers and received offers. The funding goal isn't sufficient to cover the total costs of the project, but together with private funding it is enough to build the wooden platform structure, the wooden deck, and manufacture the tent which is the minimum to have glamping operational at Figueirinha. If we get over the funding goal we will continue to cover the material costs in the following order:

  1. Wooden bungalow;
  2. Technical textile membrane (2nd layer with anti-fungi, UV-filter and fire retardant coatings)
  3. Technical material (electrical installation, pipework, water tank, compost toilet, solar heater)
  4. Automation and control equipment
  5. Battery array and solar panels
  6. Furniture and lighting
  7. Additional Glampp Ecosystem 40 module up to a maximum of 3.

 

What You Get

Together with Figueirinha Ecoturismo and external partners we organised several activities to make you engaged with our cause. Among others, the activities include:

  • Mention at the www.glampp.com website
  • Surf camps (one or several days)
  • Bicycle rentals (with or without surf board provided in a bicycle rack)
  • Lunch or dinner at Figueirinha
  • Guided tour to the iFabrica maker space in Amsterdam
  • One night, a weekend or a week at Figueirinha, either in a Glampp (from April 2014) or in the already available rooms (any date from the end of this campaign)
  • Several workshops to be given at Figueirinha such as: creative writing, liqueur making, hiking, horse-riding and kayaking for both adults and children.
  • Consultancy in setting up a glamping site
  • Customised design of a Glampp module

For multiple days or multiple person activities just sum up all the individual amounts together. If you change your mind you can always change your activities, just send us an email. Please note that you don't need to have a Paypal account to contribute. You can contribute directly with credit card after you click the "Go to Paypal" button and select the option "pay with credit card" below.

For any questions regarding booking, perks or any other inquiries send us an email to info.glampp@gmail.com


The Impact

The fast development in the tourism industry specifically in southern Europe has been responsible for the disorganised expansion of agglomerations and construction in sensitive areas exhausting natural resources such as water and being the cause for desertification of land. This has been specially critical in the coastal regions of western Mediterranean countries such as Portugal, Spain, France, Italy and Greece.

"If you look at the Mediterranean, it's unsustainable," said Walter Kreiken, a researcher for the Coastal & Marine Union (EUCC), an association based in the Netherlands which promotes coastal conservation and research into coastal issues.

The European Union (EU) has put "integrated coastal-zone management" guidelines into place, making coastal conservation a top priority for the 28-member bloc. Yet the EU can only do so much. While individual countries such as Britain and Sweden have taken the lead in conserving their coastlines, that's not happening everywhere, Kreiken said. In southern Europe, developers continue to push for golf courses and large hotels in areas where there simply isn't enough water.

According to the European Environment Agency, Portugal has one of the fastest rates of coastal development in Europe.

The Glampp at Figueirinha project can serve as example and give a message to the local authorities that the future and development of tourism can be in small-scale and low impact sustainable tourism. Figueirinha is  gorgeously located on the border of Southwest Alentejo and Vicentine Coast Natural Park, which is still one of the most well preserved and unspoilt stretches of coastline in Europe.

The threats of the continuing pressure from mass-scale tourism industry are present today and in future projects putting at risk the preservation of the coastline, its biodiversity and the authenticity of the region. This is evidenced by a recently approved mass-scale project within 25km from Figueirinha Ecotourism and inside the borders of the Southwest Alentejo and Vicentine Coast Natural Park, which was recently the object of a crowdfunding campaign to support legal action against the approving authorities.

We hope that with your help the success of this campaign can help us in preserving the beautiful and unspoilt southwest coastline through the practice and promotion of sustainable practices of tourism!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to our campaign, and if it really means something to you we incentive you to distribute it to your family and friends. Nothing is more effective that creating a buzz around the campaign! You can quickly do it by using the social media share tools in this page!


About me

My name is André Tavares, i am an engineer born and raised in Portugal. I live in Amsterdam, and I have been working the past 10 years in the aerospace industry in The Netherlands. I feel that through this project i can give something back to society by using my skills as an engineer!

 


 

Some of the images displayed are provided by Turismo do Alentejo ERT and Agência Regional de Promoção Turística do Alentejo "www.visitalentejo.pt"
story_txt:
Short Summary
The Glampp at Figueirinha crowdfunding campaign has 3 main objectives:


Build a prototype of the Glampp Ecosystem 40, a sustainable glamping module for ecotourism.

Implement Glamping at Figueirinha, an ecotourism venture in south-west Portugal. Glamping provides an unique outdoors experience with the luxury of a city accommodation.

Promote the conservation of the southwest coast of Portugal through sustainable practices of tourism.

You can contribute to the above by participating to a surf camp, to workshops, cycling along the one of the most well preserved coastlines in Europe or just relax in our Glampp or countryside rooms and enjoy the local food.

 






 
The Glampp Ecosystem 40
The Glampp Ecosystem 40 is a glamping module for sustainable tourism.

The Glampp Ecosystem 40 has been designed to use less materials and resources than conventional tourism ventures, making it a more sustainable tourism product;
There are no permanent installations, meaning that the site will be conserved and maintained to the original after removing the module.
It uses recyclable materials and either local sustainable wood or FSC certified wood.
It relies fully on 100% renewable energy through the use of solar panels, being thus energetically self-sufficient.
It uses elements from solar passive and permaculture design, such as the solar water heating system and the compost toilet.
It is smart: email reports and alarms can be sent to the site manager providing the status of the technical systems, such as the charging state of the solar battery array or water supply level.
You are closer to nature while enjoying the comfort from home!




 
 
Figueirinha Ecotourism, Southwest Alentejo, Portugal




Figueirinha Ecoturismo is a small venture of little less than 2 hectares (or 5 acres) with olive trees, organic farming, a main house with a central kitchen and living room, an outbuilding and a natural swimming pool.
In the main house there is the "Forno" (oven) room, sharing its thick walls with the traditional wooden oven, and in the "Casa Nova" (new house) outbuilding you find the "Serra" (hill) and the "Ribeira" (brook) rooms.
Thanks to its location within the borders of the National Ecological Reserve, Figueirinha is granted the silence and tranquillity of an off the beaten track refuge, even in the busy summer months of July and August. Still, it’s only 25 minutes away from the most beautiful and unspoilt beaches of the Southwest Alentejo and Vicentine Coast Natural Park.
Despite of behind rural, all needs are fulfilled and comfort was not left aside. Our solar panels assure complete energy self-sufficiency. Room kitchens are equipped with fridge, microwave oven and electric water heater.
You may ride our mountain bikes for free, hike on trails close by, swim in our natural pool or use our volleyball field. The nearest hamlet, Monte da Estrada, is a half hour walk away. There, the audacious can try the typical "café com cheirinho" (espresso coffee with a sip of "aguardente", a kind of pomace brandy). Other typical villages, such as São Luís, Vila Nova de Milfontes and Odemira, are easily reached by car.
Figueirinha is a perfect spot for those who want a restorative retreat to clean both body and soul. Yet, there’s also room for gastronomic gatherings based on Mediterranean food.
We produce our own vegetables and buy our other food items in local markets or from fair trade organizations. The same principles were applied on our furniture, fixtures or bedlinen.
Come visit us and meet the simplicity of Alentejo’s nature with a familiar and friendly touch.

– www.visitportugal.com
 
 “The fish you eat here is just fantastic! I would live here just because of the fish”

– Jeremy Irons, actor
 
“Our deal: no waves? Come back for FREE!"
– www.portuguesewaves.com

The funding goal isn't sufficient to cover the total costs of the project, but together with private funding it is enough to build the wooden platform structure, the wooden deck, and manufacture the tent which is the minimum to have glamping operational at Figueirinha. story:
So What's the Deal?

I'm your stereotypical Millennial, trying to figure out what to do with my life. I've been in the environmental field for three years now, working as a Field Teacher/Naturalist and serving with AmeriCorps Cape Cod (more info here: www.americorpscapecod.org). Because nature has always played such a major role in my life, for my next step I really want to get people excited about nature and help them to see it as valuable. I believe that once people are invested in nature and the natural spaces around them, they'll be more inclined to take action to care for these spaces.

But How Will You Do This?

My first step will be to find out what would actually get people excited about nature. Do they want to read a book or a blog, or listen to a podcast, or is social media the key? What types of social media? And what kind of information should I share? I will be able to research all this through a fantastic program called the Millennial Trains Project.  (www.millennialtrain.co) If I earn a spot in this program, I'll spend a week in August traveling across the country by train with other Millennials pursuing their own exciting projects. We'll be joined along the way by mentors looking to share their knowledge with us, and we'll be stopping in a new city each day, where I will interview people about the best approach to my nature campaign. Once this journey is over, I'll use my findings to figure out the best method to spread the word about nature, and then I'll undertake an even bigger project to do just that.

While on the train I will also be asking people whether or not nature is important to them. If they answer yes, I'll ask why, and I'll use those stories in my later project. If the answer is no, I'll ask them why not, and how I might be able to change that. Once I start my larger project, I hope to continue traveling so I can incorporate more stories from people across the country and ultimately around the world about why nature is important to them.

Why Do You Need My Money and What's In It For Me?

Here's the thing about the Millennial Trains Project (MTP): my project has been officially approved, but more projects are approved than there are spaces available, so I have to race to crowdfund the money I need to get on the train. There are only a few spots left, so please help me reach my goal as fast as possible! No contribution is too small, I appreciate any help. And if you can't contribute financially, please help spread the word about my campaign.

As far as where that $5000 actually goes, if I reach my goal fast enough, all contributions will go directly to MTP to help underwrite expenses associated with the journey (on-train accommodation, meals, and all MTP-related programming activities). And good news! It's tax-deductible, because MTP is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization.

If I don't reach my goal in time, and I don't make it on the train, none of you wonderful supporters will be charged, and you will keep your money.

In addition to a tax deduction, depending on how much you are able to contribute, I have some pretty sweet perks available! They're over there on the right, so be sure to check them out.

Why Is This Important?

Nature is a valuable resource for a endless number of reasons, and it's a resource that is constantly threatened. I hope that by making nature "cool", I can get people around the world excited to do their part to help conserve and preserve new areas of natural space and to be better stewards of the areas that already exist.

Another big reason I'm pursuing this project is that we as a society are spending less and less time outside, which is problematic for many reasons. I hope that by getting people, especially younger generations, excited about nature, they will be inclined to spend more time outdoors.
 

Are There Any Other Ways I Can Help?

If you just can't contribute, or if you can but are looking for other ways to help, I still need you! Please spread the word about my Indiegogo campaign to as many people as you can. Indiegogo has great share tools for sharing this campaign on your social media platforms of choice, but any way that you can tell more people increases the chances that I'll make my goal in time to earn a spot on MTP's 2016 journeys.

Thanks for even reading about me and my project, and wish me luck!
