story:
Every building has a North-facing wall (i.e. with azimuth 0 to 90 or 270 to 360 degrees), by the requirements of geometry.  In Northern hemisphere, any windows on these walls will hardly or never receive direct sunshine.  This project is about these rooms with no sunshine.  (Of course, we are not ignoring the Southern hemisphere.  In that case, those rooms are the ones facing South).

A number of years ago we had rented an apartment in a nice neighborhood.  The apartment was comfortable and convenient in many aspects.  However, it was very depressing.  Its only windows were facing North and the rooms did not receive even a freckle of sunshine the entire year.  We moved out as soon as our lease was over.

After that experience, we made sure to include a room with South-facing windows.  However, every place we liked had a North-facing room as well.  Several years after moving into our new place, I wanted to come up with a solution.  I considered several options, but they were either too costly, or major construction projects.  I wanted something quick and inexpensive. Then I realized, even the tiny bit of sunshine reflecting from the neighbor's window made a difference. 

Having worked in the solar industry for over 7 years, I am obsessed with using every bit of the sunshine.  Every squarefoot that receives sunshine gets approximately 200 kWh of energy per year!  Why cannot we bring some of that back into our house to brighten and warm up our rooms with a simple method?  What is the easiest way of doing this without a big investment and major modifications to the house?  Roof Mirror was the answer to that question.

CHECK OUT PRODUCT VIDEO AT MYSPACE: http://www.myspace.com/598533221/videos

Roof Mirror is basically a mirror that extends 1-2 ft from the edge of your roof and reflects otherwise lost sunlight back into your room.  This does many things: 1. Brightens up your room with natural light, 2. Provides heat, 3. Filters the air, 4. Helps prevent mold, and 5. Makes you feel better!  My primary motivation was definitely to feel better, because I love the golden rays of the sun in my room!

Roof Mirror Parts

The patent-pending initial model of the Roof Mirror is a mirror extending slightly more than a foot off the edge of the roof by means of two supports arms attached to the rafters under the eave.  It is extremely light, does not put any significant pressure to the rafters, very easy to install, and can be customized.  The angle of the mirror can be adjusted by using bolts of different lenghts to attach it on the support arms.  The arms are made from steel tubes welded together and powder-coated.

The mirror is plexiglas that can be coated with two kinds of special coatings. The first kind is transparent when there is no sun (i.e. early morning or evenings), and acts like a regular flat mirror when the sun shines on it. The second kind is a metallic-coating that diffuses the light and illuminates a larger area.

The patent-pending second model of the Roof Mirror is a slightly modified version of the first with an adjustable set of joints between the support arms and the mirror.  This allows easy setup and later easy adjustment.  The third model includes a remote control to actually adjust the mirror's angle, from the comfort of your room.  Finally, the fourth model includes a remote control and a solar-powered sun-tracking system.  We are also contemplating a satellite system that will focus the light from space onto the Roof Mirror (okay, that was a joke).  Eventually, your visitors will not be able to tell which side is South and which side North!

CHECK OUT PRODUCT VIDEO AT MYSPACE: http://www.myspace.com/598533221/videos

The biggest challenges we came across while developing this product were determining the optimum angles, the materials, and stress-strain calculations.  For the angles, we had to revisit our high-school physics knowledge on mirrors and sun's position.  It turns out there are several different optimum angles, depending on which season you want the maximum exposure.  We figured winter would be the season when the sun's rays would be most welcome into the homes, so our basic model is based on an incident angle of 25-35.  The best results for this angle are obtained at 90 degrees mirror angle.  However, you have the flexibility of changing the angle to anything you like by using longer bolts to attach the mirror.  In the second  generation Roof Mirror, adjusting the mirror angle is much easier, and in the third generation it is a matter of pressing the buttons on the remote control.

For the calculations of the static and active loads along with the stress tensors we worked with Bias Engineering, an engineering company specialising in such calculations.  Although the mirror is extremely light, a safety factor of 4 was applied so that the mirror and support arms can withstand hurricane-level winds.

As far as manufacturing goes, we are happily partnered with Premier Finishing, a California-based All-American manufacturer with decades of experience in high-tech manufacturing.  They make the support arms and mirror of the Roof Mirror from steel tubes and plexiglas. Future improvements will also be done with the collaboration of Bias Eng. and Premier Finishing. 

There are a lot of challenges in starting-up production, and that is why we are here.  First, we want to see that there is a need for this product.  That way we know it is worthwhile for us to put time and effort into the demanding work of supply, production, and distribution setup.  Second, we want to prove to possible investors that there is interest in this product so that they will give us the funds necessary to setup production and finalize legal work.  This will also pave the way for the research and development efforts for the fourth generation Roof Mirror, which will take in the order of million dollars. 

Since our biggest challenge is working with a limited marketting budget, your help in getting our voice out there by liking us on Facebook, tweeting, blogging, or chatting about us during coffee breaks would be highly appreciated!  We look forward to delivering a bombastic product that will brighten rooms up. 

After the initial fundings we will also spend more money to make a much cooler product video! (The current one was mostly filmed with a Samsung Galaxy S.)  If you have any questions about the product, please do not hesitate to contact us.  Thank you for all your supports and have a prosperous and healthy new year!

The patent-pending second model of the Roof Mirror is a slightly modified version of the first with an adjustable set of joints between the support arms and the mirror.  This allows easy setup and later easy adjustment.  The third model includes a remote control to actually adjust the mirror's angle, from the comfort of your room.  Finally, the fourth model includes a remote control and a solar-powered sun-tracking system.  We are also contemplating a satellite system that will focus the light from space onto the Roof Mirror (okay, that was a joke).  Eventually, your visitors will not be able to tell which side is South and which side North!
CHECK OUT PRODUCT VIDEO AT MYSPACE: http://www.myspace.com/598533221/videos
The biggest challenges we came across while developing this product were determining the optimum angles, the materials, and stress-strain calculations.  For the angles, we had to revisit our high-school physics knowledge on mirrors and sun's position.  It turns out there are several different optimum angles, depending on which season you want the maximum exposure.  We figured winter would be the season when the sun's rays would be most welcome into the homes, so our basic model is based on an incident angle of 25-35.  The best results for this angle are obtained at 90 degrees mirror angle.  However, you have the flexibility of changing the angle to anything you like by using longer bolts to attach the mirror.  In the second  generation Roof Mirror, adjusting the mirror angle is much easier, and in the third generation it is a matter of pressing the buttons on the remote control.
For the calculations of the static and active loads along with the stress tensors we worked with Bias Engineering, an engineering company specialising in such calculations.  Although the mirror is extremely light, a safety factor of 4 was applied so that the mirror and support arms can withstand hurricane-level winds.
As far as manufacturing goes, we are happily partnered with Premier Finishing, a California-based All-American manufacturer with decades of experience in high-tech manufacturing.  They make the support arms and mirror of the Roof Mirror from steel tubes and plexiglas. Future improvements will also be done with the collaboration of Bias Eng. and Premier Finishing. 
There are a lot of challenges in starting-up production, and that is why we are here.  First, we want to see that there is a need for this product.  That way we know it is worthwhile for us to put time and effort into the demanding work of supply, production, and distribution setup.  Second, we want to prove to possible investors that there is interest in this product so that they will give us the funds necessary to setup production and finalize legal work.  This will also pave the way for the research and development efforts for the fourth generation Roof Mirror, which will take in the order of million dollars. 
Since our biggest challenge is working with a limited marketting budget, your help in getting our voice out there by liking us on Facebook, tweeting, blogging, or chatting about us during coffee breaks would be highly appreciated!  We look forward to delivering a bombastic product that will brighten rooms up. 
After the initial fundings we will also spend more money to make a much cooler product video! (The current one was mostly filmed with a Samsung Galaxy S.)  If you have any questions about the product, please do not hesitate to contact us.  Thank you for all your supports and have a prosperous and healthy new year!

story:
HURRICANE SANDY RELIEF

In light of Hurricane Sandy, Sun Giant is committed to helping our fellow New Yorkers. For tens of thousands of New Yorkers, it may take MONTHS until power is restored.

                   

Please join Sun Giant in donating solar lanterns to families in need of light. Your contribution of $20 dollars will give a Sun King solar lantern to a family in Red Hook, Coney Island, the Rockaways, or Staten Island.  This gift is more than just a source of light.  It sends a message of hope and support that helps those affected to bounce back and build resilience.

Here is a video of some of the work we've been doing on the Rockaways.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gzTodpdMD7g

In the right margin, you will find two new perks geared specifically towards on-ground Sandy relief.

Check out how the Sun King gave light to an NYU residence hall during the storm.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q1ENyu_MNgw

 

----------------------------------------------------------------

 

The Project

Sun Giant Energy is a social enterprise that will operate in Liberia to bring safe, affordable, and reliable solar energy solutions to the region. With less than 1% of Liberians having access to grid electricity, the vast majority rely on dirty, gas-fueled generators and kerosene lamps. Aside from being a serious hazard to both personal and environmental health, the generators and lamps are inefficient and incredibly expensive -- Liberians spend up to 80% of their income on energy! Can you imagine spending up to 8 out of every 10 dollars you earn to power your lights and charge your electronics?



By distributing and maintaining the highest quality solar lanterns and plug-and-play off grid solar systems, we aim to eliminate the need for gasoline and kerosene in households, businesses, schools, and health facilities across Liberia.  Sun Giant Energy will provide financing packages that will save our customers money from day one and allow them to buy and own their system over the course of one to two years.  Once the system is paid for, the energy it produces is free for the lifetime of the product.  

Harnessing the power of the sun, we are working with Liberians to create increased financial freedom and energy independence. Our mission is based on the simple but powerful idea that access to reliable, clean energy sources is the steppingstone needed for Liberia to succeed in creating innovative, community-driven development. We’re ready to hit the ground running with a full scale pilot program in January, but we cannot do it without you.

 

Why Solar?

Every day, enough solar energy hits the earth to power all of humanity for an entire year. What if we could take that energy and use it to power positive change in the world?  (We can.) Put simply, solar photovoltaics use sunlight to make electrical current. This technology is safe, reliable, and can power anything from a single lightbulb to an entire building. In Liberia, harvesting one’s own solar fueled electricity means a brighter future for: students who can read and do homework into the night, business owners who can stay open longer, healthcare practitioners who can reliably store vaccines, the millions of people who suffer from respitory diseases caused by indoor air pollution from fossil fuels, and countless others.

Who are “we”?

Glad you asked! The Sun Giant team is made up of a mix of NYU students and alumni that met through a course in Social Entrepreneurship, where the idea for our company was conceived. With diverse backgrounds and experiences, Randy Ray, Steven Rasovsky, Anastasia Moryakova, Heidi Sloane, Shani Penn, Paxton Farrar, Nathaniel DiRenzo and Pierre Durand bring to the table the complementary skill sets needed to make Sun Giant grow strong. We’re backed up by an advisory panel of solar, legal, and entrepreneurship experts who have been guiding and mentoring us along the way. We’ve also grown extensive networks in the international solar industry and on the ground in Liberia.

Why you? (Yes, YOU!)

We envision a Liberia that will be celebrated for its restored vibrant culture, growing economy and for its access to clean energy, education and healthcare for all citizens. But we need YOUR help to get started. You, right here, right now, have the opportunity to be a part of large-scale systemic change. By backing our pilot, you are igniting the critical step of testing our model and our hypotheses on the ground in Liberia. This will enable us to tweak and adapt our approach to best serve the specific needs of millions of Liberians. Your impact starts now as we prepare for the full scale pilot program this January where we will deliver solar power to a school and a home in Liberia’s capital Monrovia, and to 100 individuals in surrounding villages!
Oh, you also get the sweet rewards listed on the side. And our eternal thanks.

 

Okay, you’re into it... but where exactly is your money going? What does Sun Giant need?

100% of the money we raise from this campaign will go to buying as much solar equipment as we can, to shipping, logistical, installation and maintenance costs, to covering the costs of our awesome backer perks, and to partially subsidizing getting our team to Liberia.  Any additional funding we receive beyond our funding goal will go only to buying more solar equipment and increasing our impact on the ground.

 

Love what Sun Giant is doing, but can’t offer any funding?

As students and former students ourselves, we understand that sometimes funding just is not an option.You can help us out in other ways: Roar with the Giant and MAKE SOME NOISE. Help us spread the word. Share our campaign on facebook, twitter, email, tumblr, blogs, reddit, any other social media, with a good old fashioned phone call, and in real life conversations!

 

THANK YOU!

Thanks for reading through, all the way to the bottom, and thanks for your support! If you’d like to learn more about us we encourage you to visit our site and to contact us.

THANK YOU!
Thanks for reading through, all the way to the bottom, and thanks for your support! If you’d like to learn more about us we encourage you to visit our site and to contact us.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Matt and I am the lucky father of three young boys and the husband to an amazing woman.  My wife and I have been extremely fortunate with the health of our children; unfortunately, this is not the case for a lot of parents in the Parker, Colorado area and as everyone knows, healthcare is expensive!

My proposal is simple.  I would like to raise money to provide those children that are forced to spend the holidays in a hospital with some Christmas cheer.  Every penny would go towards Christmas gifts for as many children as we can reach with the money we raise.  All gifts would be anonymous as the only thing we are looking to do is to help these financially burdened parents provide their children with a wonderful Christmas.

If this campaign is successful then I will re-launch one at least once a year with the same goal in mind.  My hope is that others will join in and do the same for their local area hospitals.

What We Need

What I need is simple, money for toys.  Every penny (minus the fee charged by this site) will go to gifts for the kids and likely a few things for the parents as well.  I want to make their situation as enjoyable as possible and help their parents provide their children with a great Christmas.

If the goal is not met then your money will be refunded.

    The Impact

    Have you ever seen a child's eyes grow big and a smile spread across their face?  If you have been lucky enough to experience the pure joy of a child's happiness then you already know the impact you will have.  I will ask the parents of the children receiving gifts to take pictures, if they are comfortable with sharing them, so I may post them for contributors to see.  The impact will be amazing!

      Risks & Challenges

      There are no risks with your donations.  The only challenge I face is distributing the gifts to the children in the hospital, anonymously.  I will work closely with hospital administrators to ensure all of the gifts reach as many children as possible.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        If you can't (or don't want to) donate to this cause then all I ask is that you try to have a positive influence on another person's life at some point this year.  The joy you feel will brighten your day as well as someone else's life.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Lilla, I'm an environmentalist, artist and completely passionate about the forests of Brazil, regeneration of Earth systems and how collective actions can turn problems into opportunities. My main area of knowledge is Human Ecology, Botanics, Ecological Restoration, Forest Seed Production and, Ecological Food Systems.

The 5 years of undergraduate studies in Environmental Management gave me a good understanding of conventional science, which is clearly important, but not enough to face the complexity of the environmental crisis we are currently facing. 

Now, I want to go beyond and join the master programme in Holistic Science at Schumacher College. The MSc will allow me to explore new scientific methodologies and deeply understand the complex dynamics of a living  Earth. For a whole year, I will dive deep into the understanding of the relationship between culture and nature, integrating qualitative and quantitative aspects of the phenomenon.  It's a science that goes beyond science and this holistic approach brings to light a new paradigm, inspiring hope and action to solve the pressing challenges we face.
I want to make all this knowledge accessible for everyone. Therefore, I will make a series of 7 videos titled "In Service to the Earth", a learning journey divided into 7 episodes in which I will try to answer "how can we regenerate the Earth?". I want to spread hope and sparkle inspiration to shift our culture. 

This campaign is an opportunity to do good in the world and start a regenerative culture, it will result in a lot of trees being planted and plastic being collected from the ocean/and land. Little actions can have a huge impact. Find out below.

IT`S ALL OR NOTHING (=

What We Need & What You Get

I have two kinds of reward to offer.

My art pieces and my service to the Earth.

- An Ink drawing fusing elements of the natural world with freestyle abstract patterns (Ink in Heavyweight Vellum paper) - A4, A3, A2;

- Botanical illustration - a realistic watercolor painting of a flower with a lightness only watercolor can give (100% cotton paper) A3;

- Clay sculpture - candle holding;

The service to the Earth my campaign will result:

- I will be planting several native trees in your honor. The species and the place will be chosen according to the specific ecosystem needs. A little video will show the result, explain why and thank you for your support.

- I will be collecting plastic from the ocean and land in your name (measured in bags). I will make a little video showing the results and thanking you for your support.

The funding will pay the MSc fees.

There are two options: Residential and non-residential.

Residential fees are £22,591

Non Residential fees are £16,126

I was offered a bursary of £5,000 and I'm working in Spain for two summers and saving all the money I can. I have saved around £8,000, so I will need just £3,126 (€ 3,552) to pay the remaining fee. 

I'm asking for €4,000 (€320, 8% Indigogo fee + €128 for art material and shipping costs - Heavyweight Vellum paper, ink, watercolor and mail tube).  

1st Gol ===> €4,000  (the minimum I need to join the MSc programme)

2nd Gol ===> €7,700 (MSc fee + € 3,120 living cost)

3rd Gol ===> €10,000 (residential fee)

All the help is welcome, the campaign is All or Nothing!

The Impact

This project has three levels of impact.

1st level of impact - direct impact on ecosystems. 

Taking out plastic from the oceans have a direct positive effect on marine ecosystems as plastic is extremely harmful to marine wildlife. Even if I can't take alone all plastic from the oceans alone, I can collect a good amount, and this "small" amount can make all the difference at an individual level. I'm already collecting plastic from the ocean and I will keep doing it no matter what, but the campaign will set goals for bigger amounts.

The trees will also have a direct impact on ecosystems, but for a long-term. I want to choose species that can support the wildlife and I will prioritize locations where the trees are needed. Not all trees will survive, but each tree that can grow healthy is worth a lot to ecosystems.

2nd level of impact - hopefully, the series of videos will reach a wide public, inspiring people to take action for the regeneration of the Earth and help to shift to a new paradigm. The knowledge should be available to all.

3rd level of impact - this masters will change my world and inspire a deep level of understanding. I will be able to develop skills to be in service to the Earth, create new solutions for the environmental challenges and in future become an educator for transformative learning.

Risks & Challenges

This is an All or Nothing Campaign, which means if I don't reach my goal, all your donation will come back to you.

All the rewards are time demanding, I can take a little while to be able to produce your art piece, but for sure it will be sent soon or later. I will keep in contact.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

All the help is welcome, no matter if it's donating, getting the word out and making some noise about my campain or by helping me collecting plastic from the ocean.

You can share, like, write a post, send some love, plant a seed or what your heart feels good!

Thank you so much for your attention, trust and support!

story:
Short Summary

Why donate to my project so I can pay for my Graduate Degree at Columbia?  

Because by investing in my high education, you are sponsoring one of the future environmental world leaders who will help us navigate the challenges of climate change.  

Which a more worthwhile investment of your money: green technology or my tuition? 

Investing and providing funds for green technology is important and a necessary means of jump-starting a new economy and our efforts to change our ways. However, investing in a person like me who has the dedication and motivation as I do for environmental issues is like giving donations to alternative energy projects, restoration projects, conservation projects, and environmental projects.   You get a high rate of return for each dollar donated. During my career, I will be an integral part of 100's if not 1000's of environmental, energy, restoration, and conservation projects.  

Will your donation contribute to a better world? 

Yes!  If you think we need the natural world in order to survice as a species and you believe that climate change is a very real and potentially destructive human caused phenomena then this is a project that you can confidently say your money was an investment in your future, your children's future, and their children's future.  

My Passion

Knowledge about Climate Change has always been my greatest passion in life.  After a great deal of reflection, I have realized that my dream job would be helping to create the foundations and infrastructure for a mountain of resources and innovation that will help the US adapt to the changes in our climate that will be happening in the next 50 years.  I believe that it will not be just one solution or change, but an entire frame shift of thought.  Such a change would be most effective and timely by creating an Institute for the Education of Environmental Innovators.  We already have many of the proven clean tech solutions — wind, solar, biofuel, geothermal, electric cars, green buildings, smart grid and energy efficiency technologies — we need to do is replicate and scale these solutions through proven green economy companies, projects and substantial investment capital.  I have been accepted to the Earth Institute and Columbia University where I will collaborate, learn, grow, and begin to work with others to create the innovative technologies and knowledge that will create a sustainable future. 

What I Need 

My goal is to raise $10,000 from your donations here on indiegogo to help me cover the cost of tuition. Any amount donated will help me reach my goal. By investing in my future, you are also investing in the planet's future! 

The first day of the program is May 28, which gives me about 6 weeks to find the funds I need to attend CU. I'm attempting to raise $10,000 to start me off.  Please help me reach my goal!  

What You Get

In addition to the satisfaction of knowing that you are contributing to the education and professional grooming of one of the next environmental leaders who will help us navigate an uncertain future, you will receive... 

Special tokens of my appreciation for donations of $30, $100, $1000, $10,000.

The Impact

Your Contribution

Allowing a dedicated and passionate future world leader the chance to follow his dreams.  By donating you will be contributing to furthering the education of an individual with a proven record of achievement and success.    

My Three Promises 

  • I will work tirelessly everyday for the rest of my life towards solving some of our most pressing problems.  
  • I will use my knowledge, experience, connections, talents, skills, degrees, and qualifications to make the world a better place.  
  • I will remain humble and grounded; I will not only be the change I wish to see in the world but also teach others how to do the same. 

As a Future Environmental Leader, I Will Be Involved In:

  • Water quality and scarcity 
  • Climate change adaptation and mitigation
  • Waste reduction and management 
  • Domestic production and international trade
  • Energy and efficiency 
  • Protection and conservation of biodiversity 
  • Ecosystem restoration and reclaimation 
  • Global demand for energy resources 
  • Stability and security of energy supplies
  • Improved and sustainable resource use
  • U.S. energy independence 
  • Profitable conservation 
  • Food supply, quality, and quantity
  • Climate change adaptation and mitigation
  • Unpredicted issues and changes 

Leading, Coordinating, Reasoning, Communicating, Learning, Cooperating, Engineering, Coordinating, Mapping, Changing, Modeling, Conserving, Managing, Consulting, Innovating

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't contribute! It's a recession and everyone has felt its reprecussions.  So let's get creative, you can still help! 

  • Get the word out and help me get some visibility. 
  • Use the power of your voice by talking about the difficulties people are having funding their higher education in our country. 
  • Use the Indigogo share tools and post this everywhere on the net! 
  • Contact me on social networking sites, follow me, ask questions, give advice, and participate.  
  • Make art celebrating the environment and our hopeful future. 
  • Send coupons and discounts that can be used in New York. 
  • Share secret information with me that will help me in my quest.  

And that’s all there is to it. Or is it? 

Long Summary

Hi! Please help me fund my graduate degree so I can help others. I am about to begin a program at Columbia University that is going to give me the skills, knowledge, and connections to create and change environmental/climate initiatives and laws. I have devoted my life to helping other people and making the world a better place and now I am taking the steps to make large scale changes. However, I am still tens of thousands of $ short of the amount of tuition. For me and maybe for our future ability to adapt to climate change, this needs to happen. I work extremely hard and am dedicated to creating a better, more sustainable future that will strengthen our economy and GDP.

It is a year long accelerated program starting May 27 so by May 2014, I will have my Masters of Public Administration in Environmental Science and Policy. It is through the School of International and Public Affairs at CU and they have a 98% job placement within a year of graduating. A year from now, I will already be making a difference because you were gracious enough to believe in me.

I applied to ESP because over the past 5 years, no matter what I've been teaching my kids, I have always found myself connecting it to environmental science, climate change, policy, and social responsibility. I've dreamed about being able to do the kinds of stuff we'll be doing since I was a kid, I just never thought I'd be able to go to school for it or get a high demand/high paying job for it. I found out this past fall that I was wrong and immediate starting applying. I think it's the right time and good things are happening in the world. This is why I know I will find the funding for the program one way or another.

Environmentalism (knowledge of, protection of, use of, and restoration of, etc) is my greatest passion and by joining the program at Columbia, it is now becoming my most dedicated life-long pursuit.

My goal is to fund $10,000 from 5 difference sources. Anything you are able to donate will help me reach my goal with this one. If you are feeling particularly generous, visit my other fundraising sites and donote there as well.  Thank you!!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Why donate to my project so I can pay for my Graduate Degree at Columbia?  
Because by investing in my high education, you are sponsoring one of the future environmental world leaders who will help us navigate the challenges of climate change.  
Which a more worthwhile investment of your money: green technology or my tuition? 
Investing and providing funds for green technology is important and a necessary means of jump-starting a new economy and our efforts to change our ways. However, investing in a person like me who has the dedication and motivation as I do for environmental issues is like giving donations to alternative energy projects, restoration projects, conservation projects, and environmental projects.   You get a high rate of return for each dollar donated. During my career, I will be an integral part of 100's if not 1000's of environmental, energy, restoration, and conservation projects.  
Will your donation contribute to a better world? 
Yes!  If you think we need the natural world in order to survice as a species and you believe that climate change is a very real and potentially destructive human caused phenomena then this is a project that you can confidently say your money was an investment in your future, your children's future, and their children's future.  
My Passion
Knowledge about Climate Change has always been my greatest passion in life.  After a great deal of reflection, I have realized that my dream job would be helping to create the foundations and infrastructure for a mountain of resources and innovation that will help the US adapt to the changes in our climate that will be happening in the next 50 years.  I believe that it will not be just one solution or change, but an entire frame shift of thought.  Such a change would be most effective and timely by creating an Institute for the Education of Environmental Innovators.  We already have many of the proven clean tech solutions — wind, solar, biofuel, geothermal, electric cars, green buildings, smart grid and energy efficiency technologies — we need to do is replicate and scale these solutions through proven green economy companies, projects and substantial investment capital.  I have been accepted to the Earth Institute and Columbia University where I will collaborate, learn, grow, and begin to work with others to create the innovative technologies and knowledge that will create a sustainable future. 


What I Need 
My goal is to raise $10,000 from your donations here on indiegogo to help me cover the cost of tuition. Any amount donated will help me reach my goal. By investing in my future, you are also investing in the planet's future! 
The first day of the program is May 28, which gives me about 6 weeks to find the funds I need to attend CU. I'm attempting to raise $10,000 to start me off.  Please help me reach my goal!  
What You Get
In addition to the satisfaction of knowing that you are contributing to the education and professional grooming of one of the next environmental leaders who will help us navigate an uncertain future, you will receive... 
Special tokens of my appreciation for donations of $30, $100, $1000, $10,000.
The Impact


Your Contribution
Allowing a dedicated and passionate future world leader the chance to follow his dreams.  By donating you will be contributing to furthering the education of an individual with a proven record of achievement and success.    
My Three Promises 

I will work tirelessly everyday for the rest of my life towards solving some of our most pressing problems.  
I will use my knowledge, experience, connections, talents, skills, degrees, and qualifications to make the world a better place.  
I will remain humble and grounded; I will not only be the change I wish to see in the world but also teach others how to do the same. 

As a Future Environmental Leader, I Will Be Involved In:

Water quality and scarcity 
Climate change adaptation and mitigation
Waste reduction and management 
Domestic production and international trade
Energy and efficiency 
Protection and conservation of biodiversity 
Ecosystem restoration and reclaimation 
Global demand for energy resources 
Stability and security of energy supplies
Improved and sustainable resource use
U.S. energy independence 
Profitable conservation 
Food supply, quality, and quantity
Climate change adaptation and mitigation
Unpredicted issues and changes 

Leading, Coordinating, Reasoning, Communicating, Learning, Cooperating, Engineering, Coordinating, Mapping, Changing, Modeling, Conserving, Managing, Consulting, Innovating
Other Ways You Can Help


It's okay if you can't contribute! It's a recession and everyone has felt its reprecussions.  So let's get creative, you can still help! 

Get the word out and help me get some visibility. 
Use the power of your voice by talking about the difficulties people are having funding their higher education in our country. 
Use the Indigogo share tools and post this everywhere on the net! 
Contact me on social networking sites, follow me, ask questions, give advice, and participate.  
Make art celebrating the environment and our hopeful future. 
Send coupons and discounts that can be used in New York. 
Share secret information with me that will help me in my quest.

story:
Click Here

The Project


This could be the last opportunity to save the nationally known and Historic US 30 dragstrip in Hobart, Indiana (formerly addressed in Gary)

I have a signed agreement with the owner to purchase a large section of the US 30 Dragstrip property. Enough land to have a 1/8th mile dragstrip with approximately a 1,400 shut down area.  This area includes the old Tower area, pit area, parking area and grandstands.

US 30 Drag strip has always been a family oriented facility. A place where Fathers and Mothers worked side by side with their children, where friends bonded working on each others cars in the pits. A place where people came on dates to watch the races. There are probably millions of people who have fond memories of their times at US 30 Dragstrip.

The current property owner has been entertaining offers from developers for residential and industrial usage, which made me realize I had to step in and do everything possible to save the Dragstrip from being destroyed forever.

Please not this campaign ends on July 30th, 2016.


What will be proposed to the City for approval:

The following will be included in the Proposal to the City of Hobart (again it is our proposal and has not been approved).

The standard elements of our proposal are:

A.  A 1/8th mile track

B.  One weekend day for open racing

C.  Friday evening open Test and Tune times

D. Large open sided shelters with picnic tables to give relief from the hot sun with misting stations.


Our proposal also consists of 3 unprecedented elements in Drag Racing.

1.  Garage Condominiums from oversized 1 ½ car and larger in an enclosed secure area next to the pits with a keypad to open the driveway gate and secured wrought iron type of fencing. They could be heated and air conditioned with a lift. It is a great opportunity to have some place to store your race car, work on it 365 days a year in a temperature controlled environment. There is also over 2 blocks of land the owner wants to sell as light industrial which will mean 20' to 25' tall concrete block constrution buildings for blocks between the track and the houses at the west end. Concrete buildings make a great sound barrier.

2.  Exclusive Memberships for weekday Test and Tune (proposed 4pm to 8pm) Numerous other sports have country club membership which allow its members special exclusive benefits, such as Golf Course Country Clubs, so why not for Drag Racing? We will propose Test and Tune days on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday.  Individuals can purchase memberships for any of the three days which will provide them access to the dragstrip on that weekday every week the tract is open. We will only offer a limited number of memberships to allow each racer to have an estimated 6 runs each day.

3.  League Team Racing on One weekend day. Get a group of 5 racers and form your own Drag Racing Team. Team racing will race against other teams with each winner advancing to the next run. It will be run based on selected ET with standard rules for red lighting and break outs, there will be no buy buys in League Racing. Winning Teams will receive weekly Trophies with an end of the year Banquet. You can design your own Team Shirts, car decals, logos, etc. There will be a limited number of Teams spots available.


What I am Not Proposing:

I am not proposing Top Fuel Dragstrers/Funny Cars with over 9,000 horsepower (that's 10 times the horse power of most of the bracket race cars we expect at the dragstrip) and they are much, much louder. This will eliminate a lot of the noise issues homeowners might be concerned about.

I am not proposing national events that will attract Tens of Thousands of spectators. I am proposing a local dragstrip where people can have fun with their family and friends. This will also eliminate and/or greatly reduce potential traffic congestion that homeowners might be worried about.


What We Need/What You Get

There are 3 aspects to this project.

1. Raising the money to purchase the land

2. Getting an acceptable approval from the City of Hobart

3. Raising the money to complete the reopening of the dragstrip

I am implementing an unprecedented Perk for the donations one that can be used or given away as a gift.

In turn for a donation we are offering an unprecedented Perk (gift) with a value far beyond what is being donated. We are offering 3 Day / 2 Night Vacations at your choice of over 50 cities around the country or a 8 Day / 7 Night Condominium Vacations at our choice of over 65 locations. These are NOT time share promos they are actual vacations.  The individual is responsible for room tax and a small fee ($12 for the 3 Day/2 Night vacation voucher) See below for more details.

This project will have to reach far beyond the US30 Dragstrip supporters which is why the Vacation vouchers have been selected as a Perk. Who wouldn't be willing to donate $30 for a 3 Day/2 Night Vacation voucher? So please consider placing a link for this project on your facebook page and tell your friends and family. It doesn't matter where they live or if they support Dragracing or not, the vacation locations cover cities throughout the country. The name on the vacation vouchers will be left blank so you can give them away as gifts.


Risks & Challenges

If we do not raise enough money to purchase the parcel of land under contract or if acceptable terms can not be reached with the City  there is Plan B:

While this will not allow anyone to race on the property I have discussed the ability of purchasing the front 10 acres fronting on Clay Street which would include the starting line, pit and tower area, etc. There is no way that 10 acres is sufficient to ever race on, but it provides the ability of saving the most important part of the land.. If the amount raised doesn't meet the requirement for Plan B, then Plan C is to have a Documentary produced on the History of US 30 Dragstrip with video interviews with as many of the top names and popular racers from it's Glory days as possible if there is enough money raised to cover it.

Whether you are someone that would like to see the track reopened or someone who just wants it to remain as it is a memory that you can drive by and look down the track remember, this could be the last chance to save the property from becoming another industrial or residential development. With the track torn up and warehouses, office buildings or homes built on the land US 30 Dragstrip could be another racetrack that died in the name of progress.


The Perks:

1. - $30 Donation level - Get a 3 Day/2 Night Vacation at your choice of over 50 cities around the country (these are not time share promotions, they are actual vacations). 

2. - $50 Donation Level - Get an 8 Day/7 Night Condominium Resort Getaway at your choice of over of 65 domestic and 20 international resort destinations for up to 4 individuals

The vacation vouchers will be emailed out whether the goal is reached or not starting the day after the campaign ends. Depending on the amount to be sent it might take a few days or week or so for you to receive yours.

1. -  3 Day/2 Night Vacation

There is no charge for the hotel room, You pay a small $12 processing fee and the necessary room tax on your room,( transportation and meals not included). For an example of the types of hotels included and complete details Click Here:

 www.myvacationinfo.com

Cities currently included in the 3 Day/2 Night Vacation Voucher

Arizona:  Scottsdale, Sedona, Lake Havasu, Mesa, Phoenix and Tucson
Arkansas:  Hot Springs
California:  Anaheim, Lake Tahoe, Long Beach, San Dimas and San Diego Area
Connecticut:   North Stonington

Florida:  Cocoa Beach, Daytona Beach, Ft. Lauderdale, Kissimmee, Orlando and New Smyrna Beach
Massachusetts: Cape Cod and Springfield
Maine:  Portland
Maryland:  Ocean City 
Mississippi:  Biloxi: Bran
Missouri:  Branson
Nevada:  Las Vegas, Reno and Genoa
New Hampshire: Francestown and Salem
New York:  Amsterdam, Buffalo and Painted Post
North Carolina: Atlantic Beach, Banner Elk and Kitty Hawk
Ohio:  Port Clinton
Pennsylvania: Hershey and Pocono Mountains (seasonal)
South Carolina: Charleston, Hilton Head, Myrtle Beach and Murrell's Inlet
Tennessee:  Gatlinburg and Pigeon Forge
Texas:  South Padre Island, Dallas and San Antonio
Utah:  Park City
Vermont:    Bolton Valley and Killington (seasonal)
Virginia:    Williamsburg, Shenandoah Valley and Virginia Beach
Wisconsin:    Wisconsin Dells


2. - 8 Day/7 Night Condominium Resort Vacation

There is no charge for the condominium room. The individual is responsible for room tax, and a  processing fee. (transportation and meals not included). For complete details visit: www.myvacationinfo.com

Cities currently included in the 8 Day/7 Night Vacation Voucher

North America Locations:

Alabama: Alpine
Arizona:  Flagstaff, Lake Havasu, Scottsdale, Sedona
Arkansas:  Hot Springs
California: Big Bear Lake, S. Lake Tahoe, Palm Springs
Colorado: Pagosa Springs, Silvercreek, Steamboat Springs, Vail
Florida: Daytona, Fort Lauderdale, St. Petersburg, Orlando, Pompano Beach
Georgia: Helen
Hawaii:  Big Island, Kauai, Maui, Oahu

Idaho: Hope
Illinois: Sheridan
Indiana: French Lick
Iowa: Spirit Lake
Maine: Bethel
Massachusetts: Yarmouth/Provincetown
Minnesota: Breezy Point, Detroit Lakes
Missouri: Branson, Lake Ozark
Montana: Whitefish
Nevada: Las Vegas, Stateline
New Hampshire: North Conway
New Jersey: Atlantic City, Brigantine
New Mexico: Ruidoso
New York: Catskills
North Carolina: Banner Elk, Cashiers, Atlantic Beach, Kitty Hawk, Lake Lure, New Bern
Pennsylvania:  Shawnee-on-Delaware
South Carolina: Garden City, Hilton Head, Myrtle Beach
Tennessee: Crossville, Gatlinburg, Pigeon Forge, Sevierville
Texas: Conroe, Flint, Montgomery
Utah: Park City, Snowbird
Vermont: Wilmington
Virginia: Virginia Beach, Williamsburg
Wisconsin:  Lake Geneva, Wisconsin Dells
Canada: Alberta, British Columbia, Ontario, Quebec

  Exotic Locations:
Bahamas: Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
Caribbean: Aruba, St. Maarten
Dominican Republic: Puerto Plata, Santo Domingo
Mexico: Acapulco, Cancun, Cozumel, Mazatlan, Playa Del Carmen, Puerto Vallarta


The vacation vouchers will be issued with no name on them. This gives you the ability of making multiple donations and receiving multiple vacation vouchers that you can give away as gifts. You are only allowed to use one per 12 month period (see website for complete details. See the vacation website for all terms and conditions of usage: CLICK HERE


Once the Vacation Vouchers have been issued to you they can not be resold for any reason or returned.

story:
The 70% Vegan "V-Shirt"

Finally, an environmental campaign we can all participate in!

Have you ever wanted to judge your friends and family for their dietary choices, but been unable to because you weren't a 100% vegan? Well, the 70% Vegan v-shirt changes all that! With this v-shirt you too will be able to preach to others about saving the environment, while hardly having to change your diet at all. And you'll still be 70% as good as the real thing!

By funding this project you'll not only be helping us to fund our dream, but will also receive kudos for donating to an "environmental" cause - allowing you to tell all your friends and become as insufferable as that vegan niece of yours who went vegan that one summer during her first year of college. 

Why 70%

Because we love animals. Consider if all the world adopted a 100% vegan lifestyle, and the impact and strain this would have on our precious Earth. Conceivably, greedy humans would keep all the plant-based food for themselves, which would leave nothing for the animals - in turn, animals would resort to survival instincts; reproducing more and looking at humans as a food source. The prospect of carnivorous bunny rabbits, with giant front teeth, was the impetus for our venture - we hope you share our vision for the future.

What We Need & What You Get

Due to all of the research and development fees, as well as the stringent prototyping protocols required to print a t-shirt with text across its front, we only need $100,000 from you in order to help us make this a reality. 

We thank you in advance for all of your generous donations!
story_txt:
The 70% Vegan "V-Shirt"
Finally, an environmental campaign we can all participate in!
Have you ever wanted to judge your friends and family for their dietary choices, but been unable to because you weren't a 100% vegan? Well, the 70% Vegan v-shirt changes all that! With this v-shirt you too will be able to preach to others about saving the environment, while hardly having to change your diet at all. And you'll still be 70% as good as the real thing!
By funding this project you'll not only be helping us to fund our dream, but will also receive kudos for donating to an "environmental" cause - allowing you to tell all your friends and become as insufferable as that vegan niece of yours who went vegan that one summer during her first year of college. 

Why 70%
Because we love animals. Consider if all the world adopted a 100% vegan lifestyle, and the impact and strain this would have on our precious Earth. Conceivably, greedy humans would keep all the plant-based food for themselves, which would leave nothing for the animals - in turn, animals would resort to survival instincts; reproducing more and looking at humans as a food source. The prospect of carnivorous bunny rabbits, with giant front teeth, was the impetus for our venture - we hope you share our vision for the future.

What We Need & What You Get
Due to all of the research and development fees, as well as the stringent prototyping protocols required to print a t-shirt with text across its front, we only need $100,000 from you in order to help us make this a reality. 
We thank you in advance for all of your generous donations!

story:
$10,000 MATCH dollar for dollar Meet Margaret, Michael's Grandma and learn about her generational challenge. Every dollar matters! #10kGrannysWay

With $100,000,
we'll begin empowering
every child in every school
with myActions bracelets
and tablets for sharing
their actions to create
a better world.

Champions for a New Generation

Thane MaynardDhani Jones

Executive Director of the Cincinnati ZooFounder of BowTie Cause, Former NFL Player

 Project

 Impact

 Tech

 Press

 Perks

 Team

_________________________________________________________________________

  A New Generation of Change


·  RFID Bracelets | inexpensive -
no smartphones or apps required

·  Tablets | quickly share actions and
see personal and collective impact

·  COPPA compliant system |
safe community for children under 13

With your support, every child in every school will have the opportunity to share their sustainable, caring and healthy actions with a simple swipe of a RFID bracelet on tablets at their schools and at home from any device.


A successful $100,000 campaign will advance our work from fully functional "prototype software and hardware" to "turnkey technology programs" ready for elementary, middle and high schools by this Fall. 

_________________________________________________________________________

  Real World Impact

As each real-world action is shared on the myActions platform, we recognize and celebrate the impact of both the individual action and the collective total of all students.  These actions inspire others to do more and share more. Today's youth are growing up in a world of social tools and digital savvy.  They focus their energy and engage their friends when the experience is social and worthwhile.  

Extending to a younger audience will unlock a wave of positive change.  What is possible? The spirit of this generation is contagious; college students embraced myActions and spread it across friends, clubs and campus with simple everyday actions.  It is time to scale and empower this entire new generation to lead the way.

TODAY College Students                              IMAGINE If every child...                

75 campuses                                                    was inspired to take one action.

100,000+ individual actions                         In just 1 day, if every child...

_________________________________________________________________________

  Technology

Meaningful Experiences | We design platforms with an understanding of the influences and desired experiences to inspire each age group.  The preferences and priorities between elementary, middle and high school are significantly different, yet each can be activated to achieve a shared positive outcome.  This entire generation demands authenticity from friends, products and organizations.  myActions amplifies real action and impact while allowing the students to shape the virtual community culture.  We have developed proven technology and an engagement methodology specific for youth audiences to inspire, connect and activate green and good behaviors. 

Social Matters | Kids and teens are willing to try new things and they prioritize anything social.  However "it" must be engaging and worthwhile to continue to earn their sought-after time and attention.  We incorporate gamification, social motivations and a personal connection to a cause into our design to engage every new member. Our technology lets all users participate comfortably within their personal style: a curious individual eager to explore,  a friend who showcases their most interesting achievements to gain recognition and inspire others, and leaders who can demonstrate success and motivate friends, clubs, classrooms and their school.

COPPA Protecting Our Youth | Children under the age of 13 are as passionate about causes and conservation as older kids and are as eager to share their progress and be change makers.  We have developed a COPPA compliant system which protects the identify of kids through the use of avatars and simulated environments so they can share actions, see their impact and receive safe encouragement from the community.  

RIFD Bracelets & Tablets K-12 | Introducing inexpensive RFID bracelets removes the barrier of privilege (smartphones) which is typically required to participate in a new technical innovation.  They also address the restriction of students using phones while at school.  Placing specially programmed tablets in strategic locations across the school allows for a simple swipe of a bracelet without disrupting the focus at school.  The bracelet also provides each student with a visible expression of their involvement inside and outside of school. 

Multi-Input Devices | Teens think nothing of their rapid navigation across a myriad of apps, programs and devices every day.  Text, check-ins and mobile are all natural and highly engaging social contexts for middle school and high school students.  Elementary aged children are curious, creative and eager to contribute energy, ideas and effort on any device.   Our current design has established many flexible entry points to meet any child at any stage.  

_________________________________________________________________________

 Press

_________________________________________________________________________

 Perks

story:
With wings of brilliant hues plying the breezes on a sunny day, butterflies are an ultimate expression of nature's beauty and strength. Like the multitudes of insects species and other creatures, each kind of butterfly fills a unique role in the Web of Life, but butterflies are endangered by environmental change with numerous species suffering drastic recent declines. This project will use kites as a novel medium to teach people about the diversity of our native North American butterflies and ways to get involved in their appreciation and conservation.    

Why kites?

We should seek avenues, new and old, for people to experience, enjoy and learn about nature. The kite line provides the flier with a responsive, direct connection with the same forces and processes that sustain life on earth, while the sail provides a uniquely expressive artistic canvas. Kites bring people outside to see the real world! In Western Society, kites are usually thought of simply as toys, but through play they can stir the imagination for the flyer. As an invention appreciated almost everywhere, the kite can work as a compelling medium for communicating the wonder and beauty of our natural heritage, especially less conspicuous animals such as butterflies. Like the butterflies themselves, the kite designs in this project will cast intricate, captivating butterfly wing patterns against the blue sky.

The Edo Kite
Edo was the former name of present-day Tokyo in the Edo Period (1603-1867) and it was during this time that craftspeople there developed the world’s most refined kite. The Edo is unique among kites for its numerous and very long bridle lines. Other kite designs lend aerodynamic stability with tails, vents or engineered contours, but the Edo flies straight with a different principle: the bridle lines’ mass shifts the kite’s center of gravity several meters forward of the sail. A mathematically-described shape, the bridle catenary forms a graceful, dancing arch between the kite and the kite line tow point. As it sways to and fro, the Edo bridle catenary corrects for shifting breezes to keep the kite steady in the sky. In Japan, the washi mulberry paper sails are sometimes decorated with rich, narrative illustrations that reflect both a reverence for tradition and individual creativity. In a singular way, the Edo kite draws together the love of nature with the power of human imagination.

Below, a wild Karner Blue (top), sail design drawing from Karner Blue hindwing pattern (left) and completed Edo kite on the flying field (right).

Specifics
This campaign will support the purchase of kitebuilding materials, an action camera and greeting card custom printing. Photoshop sketches (see images) have resolved kite designs honoring two endangered butterfly species, while I will complete four more to assemble a complete series of project kites. The sail designs are rendered in reverse appliqué, a sewing technique that creates a striking stained glass effect with bright sunshine illuminating the radiant colors of the kites in flight.

After building the kites, we will make use of them in these ways to communicate appreciation and conservation of endangered butterflies:

  • Event flights - the kites will fly at local environmental education events, as well as public kite festivals. A printed 1/2-sheet flyer will convey details on the butterfly species and their conservation, as well as the unique history and construction of the Edo kite.     
  • Gallery shows - two local organizations have expressed interest in showing the  kite series in their gallery spaces. The luminous quality of the reverse appliqué sails and the elegant Edo kite spar & bridle configuration also lend themselves to appealing indoor display.
  • Video production - we will use video clips of kite flights and wild butterflies in their habitats to produce a video for online publication. This video can also play as a loop on a monitor set up with the gallery show. 
  • Greeting cards - we will select three of our best photographs of flying kites to print as folded greeting cards.  These cards will include a printed message on the back cover describing the kite, the butterfly species and species conservation. Greeting card sets are listed as one of the campaign perk options.

The kite sail designs will use the wing patterns of these six butterfly species:

  1. Early Hairstreak (Erora laeta)
  2. Frosted Elfin (Callophrys irus)
  3. Karner Blue (Plebejus melissa samuelis)
  4. Poweshiek Skipperling (Oarisma poweshiek)
  5. Regal Fritillary (Speyeria adalia)
  6. Monarch (Danaus plexipus)

All of these butterflies occur in our area, the Upper Midwest, USA. The Karner Blue kite is already built (see photos and campaign video). The first five species are protected with the US Endangered Species Act (ESA) and/or state endangered species listings. The Monarch—once North America's most abundant butterfly—has suffered precipitous declines in recent years and its legal status with possible ESA listing is currently in review by the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service.  While most people are familiar with the Monarch, the other butterflies are less conspicuous animals that live in more specialized and endangered habitats. This project provides a new way for people to find out about these lesser-known butterflies.

Below, the critically endangered Poweshiek Skipperling (left) and the rare Early Hairstreak  (right).

The Impact
There is great urgency for the task of teaching people about these butterflies and other endangered species. The pressures that have led to their declines, such as habitat destruction, pesticide use and climate change have continued or accelerated.  Legal protections that have saved these species and many others, including the ESA and state endangered resources authorities, are themselves gravely imperiled by recent political changes. These kites will present the beauty of these animals along with a few scientific details in a memorable, uplifting way and encourage people to learn more about butterflies and participate in their conservation—the overarching goal for this project.

We hope that this project will also promote interest in kitebuilding, kite flying and single-line kites. There are few activities more restorative and fun than going outside to fly a kite on a beautiful day. The campaign backer perks include handmade kites of original design and a few other items to use for flying kites. 

Below, the color plan drawing for the Regal Fritillary (Speyeria adalia) Edo kite.

Campaign Backer Perks
Scroll down to see pictures of these items. Look in the page margin to click the backer perk links.

For the most basic backer level ($7+) I will shoot the best photograph of one of the new kites in flight that I can for printing as a (Thank You!) postcard and mail it to you. Backers contributing at this level and higher will also receive a personal thank you on the Moonwort Studio Website project page.

The Washi & Bamboo Kite Kit ($19) includes all of the materials you need to build a mini (11" X 8") butterfly kite. The washi mulberrry paper sheet is printed with the kite pattern and a complete instruction sheet is also included. This kite is pretty easy to build, but requires some detailed work to attach the spars and bridle. For ages 12-adult.      

The Kite Line Winder ($16) and Larger Kite Line Winder ($21) will work well with any homemade or commercial kite. Use the former with 20-50 lb. kite line and small (<36") kites and use the latter with larger (>36") kites and 20-150 lb. kite line. These plywood winders are more enjoyable to use in comparison with the common plastic hoop winders.

We will gather three of our best kite photographs to custom print three unique 5.5" X 4" folded Greeting Cards with envelopes and pack these as a set of fifteen to ship to you at the $20 level. The card inside folded spaces will be blank for your personalized messages, but the back covers will include notes describing the endangered butterfly species and the kite.

The Smaller Handmade Kite ($180) will use one of the project butterfly motifs to sew a sail for a kite finished and bridled as a 22" X 33" Ohashi Variant Edo. This kind of kite has just three spars and a 2-leg bridle, so it is much easier to assemble and fly in comparison with a traditional Edo. I will also pack one of the plywood kite line winders, 250' of 20 lb. kite line, a carrying bag and a repair kit with the Smaller Handmade Kite.

The Handmade Kite ($350) will use one of the butterfly motifs to sew an additional sail for a kite finished and bridled as an Ohashi Variant Edo with the same dimensions (34" X 52") as the project kites. This kind of kite has just three spars and a 2-leg bridle, so it is much easier to assemble and fly in comparison with a traditional Edo. I will also pack one of the plywood kite line winders, 500' of 50 lb. kite line and a repair kit with the Handmade Kite.

Below, the Washi & Bamboo Kit Kit pattern and the assembled butterfly kite with tail in the sky.

Below, the Kite Line W and Larger Kite Line Winder. The second image shows the line winder with 250' of Dacron kite line.  

Below, a series of shots show the easy-to-fly Ohashi Variant Edo on the flying field.

story:
Have fun save water.

Get some SWAG!

Let's Celebrate! The ALS challenge has raised so much money you should  celebrate the good job we've all done in helping a good cause by getting a Red Cup Party Kit!

The ALS bucket challenge maybe a fad thats gone next week but the California drought and ALS are not going away anytime soon. So we came up with a simple idea on how we could all enjoy the Challenge and continue to support ALS research while saving water.

Introducing the "Red Cup Ice Water Challenge"

Get a red cup, fill it with ice water and dump it on your head. Simple.

Same effect less water. Get some cups here or use your own. Either way let's continue the trend for the ALS cause but let's do it while saving water.

All of the perks you can get here will be a reminder of all the fun we had with this Challenge and also that there are people still looking for a cure for this disease. So I challenge you from today to doing this challenge right, because saving water concerns all of us. Let's make a difference, get a California Drought Red Cup to show your support, or just dump a cup of ice water on your head instead of a bucket. 

Proceeds will go to ALS.

Mens/Womens USA Red Cup T-shirt

Mens/Womens California Drought Red Cup Challenger T-shirt

Red Cup Shot Glass

Red Cup Water Bottle

Red Cup Mug

Red Cup Hat



Red Cup Challenge Beer Pong Kit:
12 California Drought Red Cups AND 12 USA Red Cups

story:
Hi,

Used EV's (Electric Vehicles) are increasingly cheap to buy, and incredibly cheap to run, in comparison to a Petrol or Diesel car.

They also produce zero emissions wherever they are driven, and so are of great environmental benefit in our urban areas.

However, like many of us, I cannot currently afford to buy or lease one at the moment, at least in part because of the high costs of running a conventional car !

I would therefore like to use Indiegogo to crowdfund the 5000 GB Pounds deposit I need to allow me to replace my dirty and expensive current car with a clean, cheap and emissions free electric one.

If I am successful, I also hope that this may encourage others to take this same route to replacing their Petrol and Diesel polluters, and so create a new way to broaden the appeal of these fantastically beneficial cars.

If this was done on a big enough scale, it could not only benefit the budgets of a greater number of owners as well as the environment, but it could even play a part in improving the re-sale values for existing EV owners !

The 5000 GB Pounds I am asking for will pay the deposit on a used Nissan Leaf, on a 'Personal Contract Plan'.  I will then be responsible for all further costs.

This is a 'Fixed Funding' appeal, so If I do not reach my target of 5000 GB Pounds, your donation will be returned.


These cars are a great example of modern technology helping to reduce our society's impacts on our Environment, as well as on our individual Bank Balance's.

So please give generously, and I hope that my success will serve as a Catalyst for a far wider uptake of these remarkable machines.


I hope you can help, 


thanks,


Nick.

.
story_txt:
Hi,Used EV's (Electric Vehicles) are increasingly cheap to buy, and incredibly cheap to run, in comparison to a Petrol or Diesel car.They also produce zero emissions wherever they are driven, and so are of great environmental benefit in our urban areas.However, like many of us, I cannot currently afford to buy or lease one at the moment, at least in part because of the high costs of running a conventional car !I would therefore like to use Indiegogo to crowdfund the 5000 GB Pounds deposit I need to allow me to replace my dirty and expensive current car with a clean, cheap and emissions free electric one.If I am successful, I also hope that this may encourage others to take this same route to replacing their Petrol and Diesel polluters, and so create a new way to broaden the appeal of these fantastically beneficial cars.If this was done on a big enough scale, it could not only benefit the budgets of a greater number of owners as well as the environment, but it could even play a part in improving the re-sale values for existing EV owners !The 5000 GB Pounds I am asking for will pay the deposit on a used Nissan Leaf, on a 
'Personal Contract Plan'.  I will then be responsible for all further 
costs.This is a 'Fixed Funding' appeal, so If I do not reach my target of 5000 GB Pounds, your donation will be returned.These cars are a great example of modern technology helping to reduce our society's impacts on our Environment, as well as on our individual Bank Balance's.So please give generously, and I hope that my success will serve as a Catalyst for a far wider uptake of these remarkable machines.I hope you can help,  thanks,Nick..

story:
Long forgotten Japanese eco-technology redesigned to solve modern environmental problems.

theWaterBean: Pure and compostable coconut carbon filter adds minerals and makes any tap water delicious.

and looks seriously cool while doing it.......

 

read what makes us unique 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Why?

I have always been passionate about the environment and have always been amazed and terrified at how much plastic waste we generate daily. But I have also accepted that certain realities make it impossible to live utterly plastic free. It is useful stuff, you have to admit. So from that; the only logical conclusion is to promote reduced consumption!

And that is exactly what we intend to do.

Who am I?

I'm a Scottish / Canadian serial entrepreneur living in Hokkaido, Japan. I came here for the ski-ing and stayed (it is that good). I've started and run language schools, real-estate offices and built houses. I've designed packages for unique frozen food products and marketed a unique freezing technology used for medical cryo-preservation. My passion has always been design and manufacturing. It is simply the most gratifying thing on the world. Now that I am a Father, the second most gratifying thing. I have 2 boys now, and I really want to create something that will ensure that the world they grow up in will be just that little bit better. 

 

Plastic PET bottles!

We are declaring war on PET bottles. Well, more of a guerilla insurgency. Sun Tsu said "When faced with overwhelming odds never attack head on". Our goal is not to eliminate PET bottle sales, but to chip away at them. Each WaterPill represents 280 bottles NOT polluting our environment. It also represents 280 bottles not being produced and 280 bottles worth of profit not reaching corporate pockets.

 

 

Use of funds

We'll be using the funds for purchasing the steel injection molds, finalizing packaging design, funding a minimum first order from the manufacturer, paying the PR people to spread the word and the numerous other small expenses incurred by start-ups. I know what I'm doing when it comes to manufacturing. I've been involved in designing and manufacturing numerous products ranging from sea urchin freezer packs to a patented micro wave frozen sushi tray (no kidding!!!! I'm a co-patent holder on that).

Is it easy to make this product?

Oh yes it is. A BIC pen, a symbol of mass produced simplicity, has 9 components. This product has 4. It couldn't get any simpler. It was also designed in conjunction with a manufacturer of injection molded water filtration devices. Essntially there should be no surprises as after we get funded we work out a minimum order, agree on terms, and away we go.

 

 

FAQs

 

How long can I use it for?

It depends on the quality of the water you use, but for average low quality city water you can expect 2 to 3 months of brilliant clean and odor free water.

How do I use it?

Fill your bottle. Shake for 5 seconds then gently swirl the water.

How long does it take to clean water?

Time depends on the quality of water being used. Trust your taste buds.

Why do I have to swirl the water?

You don’t have to swirl the water. Natural convection will do the job.  But swirling the water forces it through the specially designed intake vents and forces it over the activated carbon filter.  The more you swirl the water the cleaner it becomes.

Is there a benefit to swirling?

Yes! Swirling the water is a form of exercise.  Rotating your wrist is an effective exercise against carpal tunnel syndrome and reduces neck stress. It is recommended for computer users, racquet sports and golf. It is also a Yoga exercise. You get brilliant clean water and mind.

How do I know when it is finished?

You’ll notice the nasty chemical flavor and smell of your city water slowly returning.

What does Magnesium do for me?

Magnesium is the fourth most abundant mineral in the human body and an essential mineral playing a key role in many biological processes through its function in enzyme activities. It also creates great tasting mineral water. Up to 70% of people are magnesium deficient according to the World health Organization.

How do I replace the filters?

Simply pop off the cover plates, replace the old filter bags and snap the cover plates back on.  And you have another 2 to 3 months of brilliant clean and delicious tap water.

What does theWaterBean™ contain?

theWaterBean contains granulated all natural activated coconut carbon, the best quality carbon available and totally safe if ingested. Magnesium calcite, essentially granulated shells, is also added to slowly release minerals and improve the flavor of tap water. This is also completely safe if accidentally ingested.

Can I use it for drinking from rivers and lakes?

No! theWaterBean is for removing the bad taste and odors from tap water. It is for saving the world from being polluted by PET bottles and is not a survival tool for the zombie apocalypse.

Environmental impact of this product?

Your waterpill filter can replace 140 liters of bottled water or 280 bottles. That’s two large shopping carts full of plastic bottles. Our product is manufactured from BPA free materials.

Can I compost the filter bags when I am finished with them?

Absolutely! Carbon and Calcium make excellent compost materials. Cut open the bag and empty the contents on your favorite patch.

story:
Caravan to the Unist'ot'en Camp

On December 13th, the British Columbia Supreme Court issued an injunction against the Unist’ot’en blockade of Coastal GasLink pipeline that would run through unceded Wet’suwet’en territories.  

For nearly a decade, the Unist’ot’en Camp has been on the frontlines of pipeline resistance. At this critical time, Indigenous people from the Great Lakes region (Ontario) are travelling to the Wet’suwet’en territories to lend their support for the blockade and for defense of land and water.

Any extra funds will support the needs of the Wet’suwet’en resistance. All the funds raised will be sent directly to the camp and then distributed the caravan.

For more information or to donate directly to the Unist'ot'en Camp or the Gitdumt'en checkpoint please follow these links:

http://unistoten.camp/3435-2/

https://www.gofundme.com/gitdumt039en-access-point
